Title: NU denies info on reval refund again
Content:
Nagpur: Denial of information regarding decision to refund of revaluation fee in case of change in result has laid bare Nagpur University (NU) claim of allegedly running the scheme for the last five years. This is also second instance ahead of March 6 Senate meeting when a member’s request for tabling information on NU’s financial affairs in the house has been rejected.

Soon after taking charge, vice chancellor SP Kane had announced the scheme of revaluation refund to students in case their marks changed after the process. The ambitions plan gave hope to several bright students who are often at the receiving end of lethargic assessment by NU examiners and forced to pay the additional cost.

The revaluation refund, a dream project of vice-chancellor SP Kane, hasn’t seen light of the day even as little over a month remains for his tenure to end.

In view of the upcoming senate meeting, member Manmohan Bajpai submitted questions related to revaluation among others to be put up before the house. On February 20, the NU officials wrote back to Bajpai stating that the information can't be provided as per common statute issued by the state higher and technical education department last year.

On the same day, the NU had written to another senate member Sarita Nimbarte refusing to give information regarding expenses incurred on registrar post advertisements, revaluation claims, etc.

“This makes it amply clear the university never took a decision to refund the revaluation fee,” Bajpai said. He added there was nothing confidential, under consideration, or a requiring a laborious task for officials to compile the information.

On Nov 15, 2019, TOI had highlighted how NU owes around an estimated Rs52.83lakh to students of a single semester of six different courses who had failed during the Summer 2019 examination but cleared the paper after applying for revaluation.

Though Kane had announced the refund in 2015, NU exam section has not refunded a single Rupee to hundreds of students passing in revaluation in over 1,000 exams. The exam section is already under scanner for charging hefty fine from students as exam late fee without issuing receipts.

Kane didn’t answer TOI’s calls. Earlier, he had said that every eligible student will get refund if they apply and that the account number column will be added in the revaluation form.

In his queries, Bajpai asked did NU take any decision regarding refund of revaluation fee; when was the decision taken; how many students who cleared in reassessment were refunded; how many qualified students applied for refund of revaluation fee; Till date, how many students were refunded the amount.

Among her questions, Nimbarte had asked how many revaluation fee refund claims were received in last five years.

Title: Gujarat: Last day to apply for solar rooftops is March 15
Content:
Representative Image

GANDHINAGAR: The state government has extended the last date of filing applications for rooftop solar panels till March 15. Earlier, the last date for filing applications was February 28.

The government has allocated Rs 912 crore for the year 2020-21 for the solar rooftop project. The budget in the year 2019-2020 was Rs.610-crore. Chief minister Vijay Rupani said that Gujarat has received 1.06 lakh rooftop solar panel applications during the last five months, since the scheme was implemented from August 25, 2019.

He said that an online portal has been created for online filing of applications. The state government has appointed Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited as the nodal agency for daily monitoring and recognised 459 agencies to buy surplus power at the rate of Rs.2.25 per unit from rooftop solar power producers. The electricity grid will be connected to rural feeders for irrigation pumps.

The nodal agency will ensure that solar cell and solar modules are made in India to encourage domestic production, as foreign makes have not been approved by the state government, said a government statement. The subsidy for residential units is 40% upto 3MW and 20% for 3-10MW.

Title: Tiruvannamalai: Two poachers arrested for opening fire on forest guards
Content:
Representative Image

TIRUVANNAMALAI: The Tiruvannamalai taluk police on Saturday arrested two poachers for opening fire on two forest guards who were chasing them on a two-wheeler after they were spotted with a country- made (single barrel muzzle loading) gun on Tiruvannamalai-Kancheepuram road.

While the forest guard riding the two-wheeler suffered pellet injuries in the face and neck due to the firing, the guard riding pillion sustained severe bruises after falling off the vehicle.

A senior police officer said that based on a tip about rampant poaching of wild animals in Tiruvannamalai district, forest department officials, who were on high alert, were conducting vehicle check and patrol across the district since Friday night. As part of this, a team of eight forest officials, who were conducting a vehicle check on Tiruvannamalai-Kancheepuram road, spotted two people with a country-made gun making a sudden U-turn a few metres ahead of the checkpost apparently to avoid being caught.

Forest guards N Sampath, 56, and R Balaji, 22, gave chase on their two-wheelers but suffered severe injuries as the man riding pillion opened fire on them. In this, Sampath suffered pellet injuries and Balaji suffered bruises after falling off the vehicle.

Simultaneously, the poachers speeding on the two-wheeler, hit a stone on the roadside and suffered injuries.

Speaking to TOI, R Kirubashankar, district forest officer of Tiruvannamalai, identified the arrested accused as Venkatesan and Sivashankaran of Melsozhankuppam and Gandapalayam in Tiruvannamalai district and handed over them to the Tiruvannamalai taluk police after they were administered first aid at the Tiruvannamalai government hospital. TNN

Title: Shrikant hotline for dues recovery
Content:
Lucknow: In order to speed up recovery of electricity dues, energy minister Shrikant Sharma is directly communicating with consumers with a message that if he was committed to uninterrupted supply to them, they should cooperate by timely payment .

Avoiding crackdown on defaulters, energy minister is dispatching over 60,000 letter to village pradhansand 10 lakh of them to farmers having tube well, appealing them to join his campaign of “Sulabh Bijli, Sasti Bijli”.

“A direct correspondence and letter by any top politician or minister, first of all emotionally connects him with his audience and secondly, it gets into record,” said Gandhian Rajnath Sharma.

Energy minister Sharma told TOI he wanted to have a direct connect with consumers and appeal to them to make timely payments that would help us give not only adequate power, but also quality supply.

Title: UP: Wife fears threat to Kafeel Khan’s life in jail, demands security
Content:
Kafeel Khan

GORAKHPUR: Shabista Khan, wife of suspended paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan , has written to chief justice of the Allahabad HC and senior government authorities demanding security for her husband who is lodged in Mathura jail for allegedly delivering provocative speech during anti-CAA protest at AMU.

“My husband is being mentally tortured in jail and is being subjected to inhuman behaviour,” Shabista alleged in a letter to the chief justice of Allahabad HC, additional chief secretary (home) and director general (jail), among others. Shabista said she feared an attempt could be made on her husband’s life in jail and demanded adequate security for him.

She demanded that her husband should be kept away from active criminals and lodged with common prisoners.

Title: Devananda’s parents raise suspicion over initial report
Content:
Kollam: Demanding a comprehensive probe into the death of Devananda alias Ponnu, her parents and grandparents have raised suspicions over the assumption that it was a case of drowning.

Talking to mediapersons, Devananda’s mother Dhanya said it was within a few minutes since she last saw Devananda that she went missing from the house. Her father Pradeepkumar said he was waiting for the detailed autopsy report.

Thiruvananthapuram Medical College Hospital’s initial report made available said the death was caused by drowning.

However, local people and Devananda’s grandparents strongly rejected this theory.

Devananda’s grandfather Mohanan Pillai said the girl had never gone to the riverside either with the parents or alone. He also pointed out that there was no chance for the girl to reach the spot where the body was found.

“The child wouldn’t even visit the neighbouring houses alone. She would invite children to our house to play with them,” he said.

It was at 10.30am on Thursday that Devananda went missing. As the house is on the banks of Ithikkara river’s tributary, search operations were held throughout the day in the river on the apprehension that the girl could have been drowned.

At the same time, police had launched statewide vehicle checking suspecting that the girl could be abducted.

However, on Friday morning, the girl’s body was fished out from the river, about 400m away from her house.

Following the postmortem, the body was brought to Pradeep’s house and buried at the house premises at Kudavattoor on Friday evening.

SIT to probe case

A special investigation team led by Chathannur ACP George Koshy is probing the case. City police commissioner T Narayanan had stated that they would probe all aspects related to the case.

However, the fact that the police sniffer dog had run-up to a deserted house in the neighbourhood is raising suspicion. The dog also had reached the spot where the girl’s body was found.

The inquest report and the initial postmortem report, which was released on Friday, had not mentioned any bruises on the body or any signs of a struggle.

Title: Gujarat: Develop safe zones for vultures, say experts
Content: GANDHINAGAR: The Conference of the Parties to the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals (CMS-COP) has laid emphasis on developing vulture safe zones and has recommended mandatory safety testing for new and existing products used for animal treatment.A paper on “Minimizing the risk of poisoning to migratory birds,’ presented during CMS-COP13 held in Gandhinagar has stated, “Diclofenac, used as a veterinary product in the treatment of cattle in the Indian subcontinent, has caused massive population crashes in Oriental White-backed Gyps bengalensis, Slender-billed and Long-billed vultures (Gyps tenuirostris and Gyps indicus) of up to 99.9 per cent in just 20 years. These three widespread and hugely numerous species, which feed on the carcasses of treated cattle, are now listed as Critically Endangered by IUCN.”The CMS-COP has recommended that to address the impact of diclofenac, the surveillance in the high-risk areas must be increased and the government should raise awareness on alternative to diclofenac.The paper, which was discussed during the CMS-COP, states that poisoned baits are used as means to harvest water birds for consumption. A study in Kenya found use of carbofuran (Furadan) baits resulting in poisoning of over 8,000 birds.“Rodenticides used in agricultural, industrial and domestic rodent control campaigns, result in improper use or disposal of rodent carcasses, causing unintentional mortality to wildlife,” mentioned the study.According to the paper, persistent organic pollutants (POPs) remain a concern in some areas. The paper points at indoor spraying of DDT and medicines used for other malaria control programmes. Further investigation showed residues of DDT in the eggs of Black Stork Ciconia Nigra.A senior Gujarat forest official here said there is no such study in India but he was sure that the birds were dying of DDT and medicines used for malaria control. He said that there was a need for such studies in Gujarat also.

Title: Should speaker disqualify MPs, MLAs: Guv
Content:
Jaipur: While Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh Narayan Singh on Saturday said that there could be no better forum than that of the speaker to decide disqualification petitions under the anti-defection law, governor Kalraj Mishra questioned whether the speakers, who themselves are members of a political party, should decide on the disqualification of MLAs and MPs in the case of defections.

Speaker C P Joshi was also present during the seminar at the assembly building.

“In my view, under the given circumstances, there could be no better forum than the speaker. The change required is disposal of such petitions under a stipulated time period,” Singh said.

Meanwhile, Mishra said, "The biggest question today is that speakers who are themselves members of a party, should they decide on the disqualification of MLAs and MPs?The alternative could be that they must rise above the political ideologies and give impartial judgment in such cases. The deadline for deciding on petitions with regard to defections by must be set so that the termination of membership could be done soon and the erring member remainsdeprived of the membership of the legislature for a longer period of time." tnn

Title: Obra mine collapse: 3 more bodies found, toll rises to 5
Content:
All bodies buried under the debris have been recovered and rescue operation has been stopped

Varanasi: Two days after the mine collapse in Billi Markundi in Obra area of Sonbhadra district, three more bodies were recovered from the debris on Sunday, putting the death toll at five.

The state government announced Rs 4 lakh compensation each of the kin of deceased and Rs 50,000 to those injured.

District magistrate, Sonbhadra, S Rajalingam, said bodies of three more labourers, Gulab, Ram Prahlad and Shivcharan, were found. “Their last rites were performed after autopsy. As all bodies buried under debris have been recovered, rescue operation has been stopped,” he said.

As a representative of chief minister Yogi Adityanath, UP primary education minister Satish Chandra Dwivedi visited Sonbhadra where he enquired about the condition of two injured labourers undergoing treatment at the hospital and met families of victims.

The minister also handed over cheques of Rs 4 lakh each to the families of labourers who lost their lives and Rs 50,000 each to the kin of injured.

Directives have been issued to district and police officials to initiate stern action against people found responsible for the incident.

“An FIR against the ‘patta’ holder of the mine, Suresh Kesari, and two other unidentified persons, has been lodged under section 304A (causing death by negligence) of the IPC. Police are carrying out raids at all possible hideouts of Kesari and other accused,” the DM said.

As many as seven labourers got trapped under the debris when a stone mine caved in during drilling in Billi Markundi area on February 28. Two injured labourers were rescued the same day and admitted to hospital for treatment. On February 29, bodies of two labourers, Surendra and Chhotelal, were recovered. On the complaint of Ram Vichar, brother of Chhotelal, an FIR was lodged in this connection.

Title: Made-in-Bundelkhand cannons to fight the enemies, says Yogi
Content:
Schoolchildren take a selfie with PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath in Chitrakoot on Saturday

Chitrakoot: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath said that the defence corridor will gain momentum from the Bundelkhand Expressway. The picture of Bundelkhand, facing negligence over the years, will change with these two projects. He said that now, made-in-Bundelkhand cannons will fight the enemies. The income of farmers here will also be doubled with the construction of 296 km long Bundelkhand Expressway which is to be built at a cost of around Rs 15,000 crore.

The Chief Minister was addressing the gathering after Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone of Bundelkhand Expressway at Bharatkup in Chitrakoot on Saturday. He said that Maryada Purushottam Lord Shri Ram had spent the most time on this holy land during his exile period. In order to take Bundelkhand to new heights, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited this holy land of Chitrakoot today.

CM Yogi said that during the difficult time of Lord Shri Ram, Chitrakoot became his support system. In same way, PM Modi has ended the 500- years wait for the construction of Lord Shri Ram temple in Ayodhya.

The Chief Minister said that earlier the Prime Minister had started the 'Har Ghar Nal Jal Yojana'. The supply of pure drinking water is going to start from this month. On the demand of the farmer of Bundelkhand, the Prime Minister covered all the farmers under 'PM Samman Kisan Nidhi'. Farmers are getting Rs. 6,000 annually. Total of Rs. 11000 crores have been directly transferred to the account of 2 crores 5 lakh farmers of Uttar Pradesh, he added.

He further said that after the Pulwama attack, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had said in Jhansi that our soldiers will decide when, where and how to take revenge. The defence corridor is being built in Bundelkhand. The youth of Bundelkhand will not have to flee to other places. Our Chitrakoot Dham will be seen as a spiritual and cultural city realizing the dreams of 'Rashtra Rishi Nanaji Deshmukh', who founded the Gramodaya University in Chitrakoot, the Chief Minister said.

Title: Fee hike: PU students’ council launches indefinite hunger stir
Content:
Puducherry: The students’ council of Pondicherry University , which launched an indefinite strike since February 6 demanding that the university revoke the increase in fees, intensified its struggle and launched an indefinite fast from Saturday to press the administration to fulfil demands of the students.

The council’s decision came after talks between the university administration and council representatives on Saturday failed to resolve the issues raised by the students.

“Unfortunately, despite the assurances given amidst all the turmoil of police action and detention (on Wednesday), the administration miserably failed to address any of our concerns. The very short meeting today (February 28), which did not witness the presence of all committee members, saw a display of utter arrogance from the administration. They were rigidly sticking to their previous proposals and baseless justifications. Since the meeting concluded on an unlawful note, the students’ council has decided to intensify the strike,” council president Parichay Yadav said.

The council said from the midnight, five students, including two council members, will begin an indefinite hunger strike at the administration block to fight the ‘sheer indifference of the administration’.

The university said the hike in fees for most of the courses was between 25% and 50%, while the students’ council furnished old and revised fees structures and pointed out that the hike in fees for the most sought-after courses were more than 100%.

Title: UPRTOU opens study centre at Naini jail
Content:
Prayagraj: Prison inmates will now be able to pursue education and take up the course of their choice as Rajarshi Tandon Open University, the lone open university in UP, has opened a study centre at Naini central jail.

The inmates, willing to pursue any of the courses offered by the open university, will not have to pay anything for it.

The academic council (AC) of the university has decided that inmates can pursue any course by paying only 25% of the prescribed fees. This amount, however, will also be paid by jail authorities through jail inmate welfare fund.

DIG, jail, BR Verma and vice-chancellor of the university Prof Kamleshwar Nath Singh inaugurated the study centre on Saturday. As many as 25 jail inmates got themselves registered in various courses. Senior jail superintendent HB Singh also got himself registered for post-graduate diploma in human resource development (PGDHRD).

“Every human being has some special quality. If an individual is vigilant, he can achieve overall development,” he said. DIG, jail, BR Verma said jail inmates had every right to shape up their intellect and ability so that the rest of their life is comfortable.

Title: Stalin, DMK leaders take part in funeral of Gudiyatham MLA
Content:
VELLORE: DMK president M K Stalin and senior party leaders, including treasurer Durai Murugan, principal secretary K N Nehru, former ministers K Ponmudi and A V Velu, legislators including A P Nandhakumar, Karthikeyan, Gandhi and other functionaries took part in the final rites of Gudiyatham DMK MLA S Kathavarayan at Pernambut near Vellore on Saturday.

Kathavarayan, 58, who was suffering from heart and kidney ailments, died in Chennai on Friday.

The party leaders honored Kathavarayan by placing the DMK flag on his body when it was brought to the burial ground located about 500 meters from his residence on Old Ambur Road in Pernambut in the morning. On Friday night, Vellore collector and SP visited his house and paid final respects to Kathavarayan’s body.

Title: Pledge for clean Ganga, cultural events mark Bithoor Mahotsava
Content:
Participants giving a presentation during Bithoor Mahotsava

Kanpur: Arti Yadav, a student of Bhagwanti Education Centre Degree College, Mandhana, emerged as the winner in the art competition held in Bithoor Mahotsava on Saturday while Satyam Rajpoot of Uma Shankar Education center stood as the runners-up.

The second day’s function began with a pledge taken by the students and the visitors that they would keep the Ganga clean and pure. Kiran Nishad, convenor of Jal Shakti ministry/Namami Gange Mission while addressing the students and others said that it was our duty to keep the river clean and fresh. We should not pour garbage and pollutants into the river", Kiran said. An Army hawaldar Vikram Singh Chandel displayed the technique of reading and hearing Bhagwad Gita by digital remote and said everyone should read Gita as it has answers to all questions.

He said by using remote, one can hear Gita in Hindi, Sanskrit and English. Later, singer Sandhya recited a song dedicated to Ganga.

The officials of the education department in their stalls informed the children and visitors about good education and its benefits in life . Charak Gramodyog Sewashram displayed its products and told visitors about the benefits of Ayurvedic medicines.

DUDA, departments of village development, panchayati raj, horticulture, women's welfare, food, child development, tourism, culture, Swachcha Bharat Mission, SBI, LIC, Bank of Baroda, KMC, Smart City Ltd, and Jal Nigam have opened stalls in the festival.

On Friday, besides art competition, students recited patriotic songs based on 'Veer Rasa'. Tanisha Singh of Motherland Academy, (Rura) was adjudged as winner in competition while Rosy Bano of Uma Shankar Katiyar Education Centre and Anamika Mishra of Abhinav Sewa Sansthan were declared joint runners-up. Smita Verma of Saraswati Mahila Vidyalaya stood third.

Title: My luckiest day: Teen who clicked selfie with Modi
Content:
Prayagraj: “It was a dream come true for me, taking selfie with the man I had always adored. His affectionate touch and interaction was fatherly. It was the luckiest day for me whether the selfie in my new smartphone was perfect or not,” said a beaming 18-year-old visually-impaired Vivek Mani Tripathi, a resident of Manda block of Prayagraj after meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Parade Ground on Saturday.

Vivek and nine other differently-abled and elderly beneficiaries were given different aids by the PM on the stage at the Samajik Adhikarita Shivir (Social empowerment camp). In all, 26,874 people with disabilities and senior citizens were given various supporting aids, including manual and motorised tri-cycles, walkers, walking sticks, hearing aids, etc.

Vivek, who is pursuing BTC, was given a braille smartphone.

Before coming on the stage, PM Modi met and interacted with around 50 beneficiaries at the venue. Mingling freely with them, he inquired about the health of an elderly and playfully teased a little kid and patted his cheeks.

“Wo bahut acche hain” (He is very nice), was what the seven-year-old Kunal had to say when TOI asked him about his meeting with the PM.

The kid, given a manual tri-cycle, has some memorable moments when the PM teased him, asked him his name and the class in which he studies.

When Prabha Devi (42) climbed down from her tri-cycle and tried to touch PM’s feet, he stopped her. “He didn’t let me touch his feet. He stopped me with folded hands and helped me get back to the cycle and said I should feel free to let him know if I need anything else,” said Prabha Devi, a resident of Meerapur.

Prior to PM Modi’s arrival, officials had provided different supporting aids to 26,874 beneficiaries, including senior citizens, who were given dentures, lumbo sacral belt, vision correcting glasses, hearing aids, walking sticks (both normal and ones fitted with sensors) etc

Title: Water supply hit in Gangolihat for six days
Content:
Pithoragarh: An acute water crisis has hit Gangolighat in Pithoragarh as the water supply in the town has been disrupted for the last six days. Residents say they are struggling to find water even for daily basic needs as many were seen queuing up in front of hand pumps.

Officials of Jal Sansthan on Saturday said the transformer in the pumping station in Salikhet had broken down due to a thunderstorm a few days back. The officials said a mechanic has been called to repair the transformer. “The mechanic had reached on Friday itself, but due to rain, the repair work has not been completed. If there is no rain, the transformer will be repaired on Sunday,” Rupesh Arya, junior engineer, Jal Sansthan Gangolihat, told TOI.

Title: UP: Youths wave black flag, detained in Prayagraj
Content:
Public thrashes youths found waving black flags during the rally in Prayagraj on Saturday

PRAYAGRAJ: Four youths said to be associated with the students’ wing of Samajwadi Party waved black flags while Prime Minister Narendra Modi was addressing the gathering at the venue and were detained by police.

The detained youths, identified as Saurabh, Deepak, Mohit and Jai Shankar, were thrashed by people.

In the middle of PM’s speech, the four youths sitting behind media gallery at the venue, suddenly stood up and started waving black flags. Almost immediately, the people sitting alongside caught hold of them and started thrashing them. By the time police jumped over the barricading and stopped the public, the four youths had been badly thrashed.

SP district spokesperson, Dan Bahadur Madhur said, “The party stands with these protesting youths as our party is with every youth who is fighting for his rights.”

SSP Prayagraj Satyarth Aniruddha Pankaj said, “An FIR is being registered against the four youths under relevant sections of the IPC and the Criminal Law Amendment Act for causing disturbance, obstructing government work. They would be sent to jail after due process.”

Title: Flyover graft: VACB questions V K Ebrahim Kunju again
Content:
V K Ebrahim Kunju

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Former PWD minister and IUML MLA V K Ebrahim Kunju was interrogated by the vigilance and anti-corruption bureau ( VACB ) sleuths on Saturday.

The interrogation was in connection with the corruption in the construction of Palarivattom flyover. The questioning began at 11am and went on for almost three hours. The vigilance has quized Kunju three times in connection with the case, but the agency has not received any evidence strong enough to arraign Kunju in the list of accused.

Sources in the vigilance said that till now he has cooperated with the vigilance in the probe and will continue to do so. He is learnt to have remained in his earlier stand that except sanctioning the recommendation to release mobilization advance to the company that constructed the flyover, based on the recommendation by the section assistant to the department secretary, there was no mala-fide action from his part.

The government had earlier sought clearance from the governor for prosecuting Kunju in connection with granting advance funds for the RDS projects, the contractor company for constructing the flyover.

Vigilance also had confiscated the file in which he had given his clearance for releasing the funds. The files regarding the clearance of funds had shown that Kunju had given clearance for releasing Rs 8.5 crore to the company for the project.

Kunju had taken a position that as the minister of the department, there was nothing unusual on his part in giving clearance as all those who are involved in handling the concerned file from the secretariat assistant to the department secretary had not objected to the request for releasing the funds.

Former PWD secretary T O Sooraj had given a statement against Kunju with regards to the release of funds. He had said that the funds were released upon the clearance from the minister. However, vigilance sources said that the agency is still in the process of examining the matter in detail and collecting evidence against the former minister.

Meanwhile, assembly speaker P Sreeramakkrishnan said that he has not received any communication from the vigilance regarding action against Kunju.

Title: Special awareness event on traffic rules at 14 junctions begins today
Content:
Nashik: A special awareness programme to stress on the importance of following traffic rules will be held at 14 junctions from March 1 to March 7. The drive has been organised by the city police.

It was inaugurated on Saturday by commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil at the police commissionserate. The event has been organised along with a private bank and a radio channel.

The private bank would be deploying 12 volunteers at different junctions. These volunteers would be dressed as Yamraj, the god of death. They would appeal to motorists to wear helmets and seat-belts, said the police.

The awareness drive will take place at the Old City traffic branch signal, CCM signal, CBS signal, Khadkali signal, ABB Circle, Jehan Circle, Modak signal, Meher signal, Bytco signal, Fame signal, Datta Mandir signal, Tarwala signal, Malegaon Stand signal, Trimurti Chowk signal, Papaya Nursery signal and others

The police have been appealing to the motorists to wear helmets and seat belts, and not to drink and drive.

Most of the road accidents occur because of human error. If people follow the traffic rules, there would be little scope of road accidents, said officials of the city traffic branch.

Last year, there were 169 fatal accidents in the city which claimed the lives of 177 people. This included 98 bikers, 15 car drivers or passengers and 42 pedestrians.

Apart from this, 385 people suffered grievous injuries and 155 escaped with minor injuries.

To bring down the number of road fatalities in the city, the police visit every accident spot to check the cause of the accident. In case of some infrastructure issue involved in the accident, the police note it down and inform their senior officer.

Following which the police writes to the civic body to take up the work like putting up road signals or blinkers, boards, speed breakers, etc.

As per the police record last year, of the 98 bikers who died in road accidents, 81 of them were not wearing a helmet.

Title: UP home guards replace .303 Enfield rifles with Insas
Content:
Lucknow: Close on the heels of Uttar Pradesh Police, UP home guards department has also decided to phase out .303 Enfield rifles and replace it with Insas (Indian Small Arms System) assault rifle manufactured by ordnance factories.

Insas is currently being used by Central Reserve Police Force, Border Security Force and police in Jammu & Kashmir, Chhattisgarh and Assam. UP Police had discontinued use of.303 Enfield rifles from January 26, 2020.

UP home guards has also decided to induct 9mm Glock pistols like police.

The process of inducting Insas started with a training exercise for zonal and regional commandants of home guards at Arjunganj firing range in Lucknow on Saturday. The commandants were trained how to use Insas and 9mm Glock pistol.

Director general of home guards, Vijaya Kumar said, “Insas is lighter than Enfield rifles and can hold more ammunition. It also does not need bolting after every fire like .303 rifle.”

Now, since home guards also being involved in security duties the 9mm Glock pistol also becomes important, he added.

“The pistol is very light and its polymer frame does not crack even after maximum use. The pistol is easy to keep and can hold many rounds,” Kumar added.

The department has already procured 231 Insas and 106 9mm Glock pistols.

Title: Man’s body found hanging from tree
Content:
Kanpur: A 45-year-old man, who had been missing since Friday, was found hanging from a tree under suspicious circumstances in Parampurwa area of Juhi in the city on Saturday.

Police rushed to the spot along with forensic experts, and after conducting preliminary investigations, sent the body for the postmortem examination.

The family members of the victim have, however, alleged that he was murdered and then hanged from a tree. Police said they are awaiting the postmortem report and investigations are underway in the matter.

Inspector Juhi, Santosh Arya said, “Deceased, Ram Krishna, a daily wager and a resident of Tyre Mandi, had been missing since Friday evening after he went out to work. His family members have alleged that he was murdered and then hanged from a tree. The autopsy report will confirm the reason of the man's death.” Ram Krishna is survived by wife Guddi, four daughters and a son.

Title: General, OBC employees announce indefinite strike from March 2
Content:
Dehradun: Upset over the delay in promotion in jobs, the members of the General-OBC Employees Federation have announced that they will go on an indefinite protest in the state from March 2.

With the budget session starting on March 3, the employees have decided to march towards Gairsain on March 2. Besides, the association has also declared to bring the emergency services to a halt from March 5.

On Saturday, employees of different states including Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh, attended a meeting at Yamuna Colony area of Dehradun to extend support to the federation members. President of the association Deepak Joshi said, “We will not back off from the protest now. We are not against any political party but are against the state government which is unwilling to comply with the Supreme Court orders.We will call off the protest only if we get an assurance from the state government that it will look into our grievances. We have not done anything illegal.”

Title: Lucknow: Verdict brings justice after 7 years, but Sahu kin want Aquil hanged
Content:
Ayush Sahu and Shravan Sahu

LUCKNOW: Smiles returned and sweets were distributed at the Sahu household in Saadatganj after a local court sentenced their son’s killer to life term, ending seven years of fear and trauma. In 2013, don Aquil Ansari murdered Ayush and after four years eliminated his father, Shravan.

“We are satisfied with the court verdict in Ayush’s case, but justice will be delivered when the accused gets capital punishment in my father’s murder. The trial is still underway,” Suneet Sahu, elder brother of Ayush, told TOI on Saturday, while narrating the family’s ordeal. On October 16, 2013, Aquil and his aide, Azim alias Babu, peppered Ayush with bullets over a brawl on purchase of beer and on February 1, 2017, Shravan, an edible oil trader, was killed by the don’s henchmen.

“Our world changed dramatically in October, 2013, when the bullet-ridden body of Ayush was brought home. But, Aquil’s criminal background and political connection could not deter my father. After performing the last rites, he walked into Thakurganj police station and lodged an FIR against Aquil,” said Suneet.

“Then too, a crowd led by a MLA gathered at the police station to oppose the FIR, but my father was unfazed. When cops delayed filing the chargesheet, he collected evidence and handed them over to investigation officer. Finally, trial began after three years, but the accused changed lawyers and sought more time. Imagine, it took 10 hearings over a year to record the statement of one eye-witness,” Suneet recalled.

“I had to take care of the family, pursue two cases despite threats and funds constraint. The court took suo moto cognizance of our plight and ordered a CBI probe into my father’s murder. CBI has filed a chargesheet and the trial is underway,” he said.

Title: Manikandan’s fanboy moment with CM Pinarayi Vijayan
Content:
Manikandan said he was a diehard fan of chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan, particularly for his unwavering stand... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: It was a dream come true for 43-year-old Manikandan when his hero chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan paid him a visit at his home at Kachani near here on Saturday.

Vijayan visited his fan when Manikandan, who is paraplegic by birth, expressed his wish to the party men in his area about his intense wish to meet the CM when the latter reached the nearby Karakulam village to participate in a housewarming of a dwelling constructed as part of the Life Mission project. The chief minister visited Manikandan at his home and spent with him a few minutes, asking him about his life, habits and hobbies.

According to Manikandan, he was a diehard fan of Vijayan, particularly for his unwavering stand on matters of importance to society. Though he was unable to undergo formal education, Manikandan has self-taught Malayalam and English and likes to read books.

Vijayan signed and gave back a book that Manikandan presented to him as a gift when the latter reached his home. “Vijayan is a leader who keeps his words. That’s why I like him the most,” said Manikandan when asked why he was in awe about Vijayan.

Manikandan is the third child of retired government employee Parameswaran Nair and wife Rama Devi .

Title: 10 days after reopening, tanneries closed again
Content:
Tanneries will reopen as soon as the damaged line is repaired

Kanpur: In yet another setback to Kanpur’s leather industry, all tanneries of Jajmau area were once again closed for an indefinite period on Friday.

This time, however, the tanneries were not at fault and the closure was ordered following a damage to common header of the line which carries treated water from common effluent treatment plant (CETP) and sewage treatment plant (STP) to irrigation channel.

Common header of the line is the point from where treated water from tanneries and STP is forwarded for irrigation purposes.

The agency concerned has started repair work and district administration has been informed about it.

District magistrate Brahmadev Ram Tiwari ordered closure of all tanneries with immediate effect which was implemented by Regional Pollution Control Board (RPCB).

The tanneries will reopen as soon as the damaged line is repaired. According to Jal Nigam sources, work on deep sewer line project was on at Pyondi village in Jajmau area for last two weeks.

On Friday, a common header line was damaged when an earth-mover was carrying out work. Jal Nigam officials closed the channel carrying water from treatment plant and started repair work.

As part of alternate arrangement, water coming from treatment plant has been diverted towards Airforce nullah from when it is getting into the Ganga.

Subsequently, it was decided to close the tanneries till further order and repair work on the damaged line was carried out.

Talking to TOI, RPCB officer Dr SB Franklin said he came to know about the incident around Friday noon when he received a photograph on his mobile phone. Later, the district magistrate informed him about the incident. “Tanneries have been closed as a precautionary measure so that effluent does not find its way into the river,” he said.

Executive engineer (zone -2) of municipal corporation SK Singh said, “The channel was damaged during digging work by Jal Nigam. The flow of channel has been diverted and repair work has commenced.”

The State Pollution Control Board had, on February 19, ordered opening of all 256 tanneries after the closure of over three months.

After working for 10 days, the tanneries had to be closed again. Tannery owners have assured the district administration and Regional Pollution Control Board that they would not go in for wet tanning till repair work of channel is complete.

Title: 6-day course on poultry farming ends at CARI
Content:
Bareilly: A six-day course on ‘Entrepreneurial development programme on A to Z of commercial poultry farming’ at Central Avian Research Institute (CARI) here was completed on Saturday. This was the first time when the institute introduced this course to help budding entrepreneurs interested in poultry farming on broilers, layers and backyard poultry.

According to scientists, broilers are reared for meat purpose while layers are reared for egg production. The backyard poultry is free-range extensive farming.

Sandeep Saran, course director, said, “We have been running specialized course but this new course, exposed budding entrepreneurs to technical and other aspects, including banking and insurance, on poultry farming. The candidates were also taken to poultry farms for a field visit. A total of 19 people participated in this course. It will be held again in the next financial year.”

Title: Charred body of factory guard found
Content:
Jhansi: Charred body of a guard was found inside a factory on Saturday morning under mysterious circumstances.

Family members of the victim staged a protest outside the factory claiming it to be a case of murder while the factory owner claimed it he died after a short-circuit triggered fire in the factory.

The incident took place inside Vinayak Transformers in Bijoli industrial estate falling under Prem Nagar police station where the body of Sundar Pal Singh (40) was found.

After the news broke, hundreds of villagers, along with the guard’s family members rushed to the factory and staged a demonstration demanding action against factory owner.

SP (city) Rahul Srivastav said the body had been sent for post-mortem and a forensic team had been roped in for further investigations.

Title: When police were grilled by people
Content:
Case 1: When a victim of domestic violence asked sub-inspector DK Singh, who was investigating her case, why did he neither arrest nor file a chargesheet against her husband even three months after she lodged an FIR, the cop started trembling. The woman, who was injured after allegedly being assaulted by her husband, then turned to senior cops supervising the conversation and told them that cops are helping her husband. The IO was sent to lines and a probe was ordered against him.

Case 2: Sub-inspector Pramod Kumar was speechless when Humara Khatoon (45) asked him why he has not taken any action against the biker who hit and killed her husband Shoaib Khan (47) in September last year. Khan had gone to buy birthday cake for hisdaughter when the incident happened. The cop was sent to lines and a probe was ordered for laxity.

Lucknow: In a role reversal, cops at police lines were on Saturday interrogated by complainants whose cases they have been probing for quite some time.

The occasion was ‘ Jan Sunwai : Amne-Samne’ (Public hearing: Face to Face) – a platform where investigating officers were made to sit before complainants and reply to their queries under the watchful eyes of senior officers.

An open space at Reserve Police Lines was converted into “interrogation room” where 48 victims, who had lodged complaints of police inaction at Integrated Grievances Redressal System, were called for the exercise meant to make cops accountable to people. Most cases were pending for last 4-5 months.

A 22-year-old woman from Banthra alleged she was sexually molested by local strongmen inside her house, but cops did not lodge an FIR under the pressure of goons. Senior officials pulled up the investigating officer and directed him to immediately lodge an FIR.

The tone was set from the very beginning of the programme when some of the cops, who were busy with their mobile phones instead of paying attention to proceedings, were pulled up. “Three DCPs sitting in the front row must stop using their phones. If they are not paying attention now, how would they focus on resolving issues later,” asked joint commissioner of police (law and order), Naveen Arora over the microphone.

Commissioner of police Sujeet Pandey said, “We found laxity on the part of cops in three cases. We have sent them to lines and have ordered a probe. The hearing will be held every Saturday. We plan to take up 400 cases every month.”

Title: Woman goes missing after cloudburst
Content: Dehradun: A 35-year-old woman, who had gone to fetch water, went missing near Rudraprayag on Saturday. The woman was identified as Yashoda Devi, a resident of Sari village around 25 km away from Rudraprayag. Police said that the woman went missing when she had gone to fetch water. They said that she may have passed away after being caught in a cloudburst .

Title: Army factory shut, 3k workers sent on leave after leopard spotted on campus
Content:
Bareilly: The ordnance clothing factory (OCF) in Shahjahanpur Cantonment temporarily shut operations on Saturday after a leopard was spotted in the premises. The big cat was initially spotted by security guards late on Friday night and later, its presence was confirmed by CCTV cameras installed on the factory campus. The OCF makes uniforms for the Indian Army.

Forest department was informed and officials placed a cage with a bait on the sprawling campus spread across 100 acres to capture the leopard. Foresters have also sought help of the Wildlife Trust of India (WTI) and installed eight camera traps to monitor the leopard’s movement. Besides, permission has been sought from higher authorities to tranquillize the big cat, if needed.

Nearly 3,000 employees at OCF Shahjahanpur unit were sent on leave after the leopard was spotted near the blanket manufacturing unit. An employee on the night shift captured a few pictures. Anurag Yadav, public relationship officer, OCF, said, “The leopard was spotted on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. After the night shift ended, work was called off on Saturday to ensure the safety of the employees. Forest department has deployed its personnel to capture the animal.”

It is not clear how the leopard strayed into the cantt area as the nearest forest, Khuthar range, is about 50 km from there. At the same time, the area’s green cover and presence of prey like stray cattle, dogs and nilgai provide the big cat an ideal habitat.

Last year in September, a leopard was spotted near Kendriya Vidyalaya school on several occasions. The forest department attempts to capture it failed and the animal disappeared after some time.

Now, MN Singh, sub divisional officer, believes that the factory leopard is the same as the one sighted near the school. “It seems it accidentally entered the factory premises. We have found its pugmarks and CCTV cameras also confirmed its presence. We are combing in the area and taking necessary action to ensure that it doesn’t harm anyone.”

Daksh Gangwar from WTI told TOI, “We have placed a cage on the campus and installed motion sensor camera traps to monitor the movement of the leopard. This animal is quite clever and had stayed away from the cage when we tried to capture it last year.”

Title: 17-year-old girl critical after hacked by her ‘drunk’ cousin
Content:
Bareilly: A 17-year-old girl was in critical condition after her 22-year-old cousin tried to hack her over a suspected tiff at Aliganj in Bareilly district on Saturday.

The girl was first taken to a community health centre in Majhgavan where the doctor referred her to district hospital as her condition was said to be critical. Police have arrested the girl’s first cousin. He was reportedly in an inebriated state and said that he was angry because his cousin used to ignore his instructions which made him angry and he took this step.

The girl is a school dropout and supports her family with household chores and also worked at the farm. She was working with her elder brother in a crop field when the accused came on his bike and called her. The youth suddenly took out a sickle from his bike and attacked her. The girl had received deep wounds on her shoulder and limbs. She was rescued by her brother and other farmers working at a nearby field. Police were called in and the girl was taken to the hospital for treatment.

Emergency medical officer Dr AK Singh said, “Her condition is very critical. She has suffered excessive bleeding from her deep wounds. She has undergone surgery and currently under constant observation.”

SHO of Aliganj police station Manoj Kumar told TOI, “We have arrested the youth who tried to kill his cousin for unspecified reasons. We are still questioning him and waiting for the family to give a written complaint.”

Title: International Waste Pickers’ Day celebrated in city
Content:
Aurangabad: International Waste Pickers’ Day was celebrated at the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation’s (AMC) dry waste sorting centre in the Vitthal Nagar area of the city.

Established by the municipal corporation, the Centre for applied Research and People’s Engagement (CARPE), Bajaj Auto and Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), the dry waste sorting centre aims at ensuring dignified livelihood for waste pickers and maximum resource recovery from the collected waste material.

A total of 13 waste pickers work at the centre. They celebrated the day by cutting a cake and indulging in fun activities. Later, some of them shared their heart-wrenching experiences and how the centre has brought a positive change in their lives. Meera Chavan, ward officer of Zone 6, along with other civic staff, was present for the celebration.

The waste pickers, who were earlier working in unsafe and unhygienic conditions, have experienced a transformation in working environment at the centre. They make a living by selling the waste segregated by them and are provided stock of monthly groceries by the centre.

A day care established at the centre provides care for the children of women working at the centre. Lakshmibai Dabhade, a waste picker working at the centre, said that earlier she had to search recyclable waste materials in heaps. “Lustful glances and allegations of theft had made my life miserable. The situation has changed now with the centre’s help,” Dabhade said.

Carpe CEO Gauri Mirashi said that if people segregate their waste and the municipal vehicles collect it in a segregated manner, not only will the city be clean, but will also bring dignity to the lives of waste pickers and the sanitation staff.

Title: Revenue staff, cops take over Theerthapada Mandapam land
Content:
Revenue officials seal Theerthapada Mandapam after taking over 65 cents on Saturday

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Armed with a late-evening order issued by revenue principal secretary , a team of revenue officials and police took over the 65 cents on which Theerthapada Mandapam is situated at East Fort on Saturday night. The move triggered late night protest by BJP and RSS workers , led by O Rajagopal MLA and former district president S Suresh .

The move of the government has political overtones as Sri Vidhyadhiraja Trust, which possesses the 65 cents that had been a big pond (Pathrakulam) in the past, has plans to construct a Chattambi Swami memorial at the site. The foundation stone it was scheduled to be laid on March 10. The trust has invited CM Pinarayi Vijayan to lay the foundation stone for the memorial which will comprise a convention centre, temple and meditation hall.

The order issued by revenue principal secretary V Venu also cancelled the earlier order issued in 1976 which assigned 65 cents to Sri Vidyadhiraja Sabha. However, the government acknowledged the existence of a Chattambi Swami temple on the land and said the government will consider assignment of land where temple of Chattambi Swamy is located if the trust files a fresh application for that parcel of land.

The order directed that the land being resumed shall be used for waterlogging mitigation measures for Thampanoor and East Fort after a technical study. The revival of Pathrakulam was one of the suggestions mooted by experts who had tried to find solution for flash floods happening in Thampanoor and East Fort regions.

Noting that there is an ongoing litigation regarding the ownership of the land between Travancore royal family and the state government, the order said if Supreme Court issued an order in contravention to government order, the government would reconsider it.

The government had in 2019 issued an order which directed district collector to resume the land and use it for public purposes cites relevant sections under land assignment rules and vigilance report against former chief secretary and founder and patron of the trust R Ramachandran Nair.

The trust moved high court against the order and the court directed the state government to conduct hearing of parties. The new order was issued after conducting hearing and verifying the documents submitted. The revenue department found that Vidyadhiraja Trust only paid 50% of the land value fixed during the assignment and the process of transfer of registry of the property got delayed following the non-payment of the remaining amount. The non-payment amounted to violation of original contract and hence the government could resume the land, the order stated.

Title: NMC’s standing committee hikes draft budget by Rs 228cr
Content:
Nashik: The standing committee of the civic administration has increased the draft budget for the next fiscal by Rs 228.55 crore — taking the total outlay to Rs 2,390.34 crore.

Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game had presented the draft budget to the panel on Tuesday with an outlay of Rs 2,161.79 crore.

Members of the standing committee discussed the details of the draft and after incorporating some new projects, the panel gave its approval to the budget on Saturday. The draft budget will be tabled before the general body soon for its approval.

Standing committee chairman Uddhav Nimse said that the panel had decided to include projects like the new boat club, textile market among other works.

“Both the new boat club and the textile market will be developed under a public private partnership model in the city,” said Nimse.

The proposed boat club will be operational in the stretch from Ahilyabai Holkar bridge to Anandvalli.

“The hyacinth and silt in the Godavari river will be removed before the boat club starts functioning. It will help boost tourism in the city,” he said.

The standing committee has also proposed to establish a textile market on the premises of the truck terminal at Adgaon over 45 acres.

“The market will be developed on a 20-acre plot lying vacant on the premises of the truck terminus. Many people from Nashik and the adjoining districts travel to the textile markets in Surat to buy sarees and garments, especially for occasions like weddings. Once the textile market comes up in the city, people will no longer need to travel all the way to Surat,” said the chairman.

The panel has also proposed two new units to make fertilisers from wet garbage on a pilot basis. While one unit has been proposed in the Panchavati area, the second one would be set up on any other location where land is available.

The standing committee has proposed to develop a new ground at Nilgiri Bag in the Panchavati division of the city. The ground is to be developed over 36 acres, in line with the Pragati ground. All sports and other activities will be conducted here.

The committee has also decided to develop five civic schools into smart schools and make them at par with international English-medium private schools.

The panel has also proposed setting up of more public toilets for women, especially in the market areas and bus terminals.

The standing committee has directed the civic administration to use Rs 250 crore remaining from the budget of the previous fiscal for various development works. This amount was earmarked for land acquisition. However, the state urban development department has put a hold on the civic administration from acquiring any land. “The civic administration can utilise the amount left unused in the previous fiscal for various development works in different wards,” said Nimse.

Title: Metro engineers to put up first pillar cap on Monday
Content:
Pier cap will form the base for placing girders in near future

Kanpur: The work of Kanpur Metro project is going on at a fast pace ever since it started in November 15 last year. The Metro engineers would erect a first pier (pillar) cap on Monday. This pier cap would form the base for placing girders in near future.

This pier cap would be erected on pillar number 19 to be constructed between IIT-Kanpur and the National Sugar Institute. Once the pier cap is erected, it would look like a T-shaped structure over which the girder would be placed.

Till Friday, 10 pier caps had been cast. Also, 42 piers (pillars) were constructed and 24 U-girders had also been cast. After the pier cap is erected, the work of Kanpur Metro would enter into the next phase, said a Metro official. Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC) would be erecting the first pier cap at 5 am on Monday, the official further said. "This pier cap will be erected on P19 (Pier or Pillar number 19) which is between IIT-Kanpur and the National Sugar Institute", he added.

The official said there will be a slight traffic diversion near the area of pier cap erection to ensure safety of everyone.

"This is a moment of achievement not just for UPMRC but for all residents of the city that they are inching towards a safe, convenient and pollution free mass rapid transit system with such an exceptional pace", said another Metro official.

Metro engineers are working day and night to complete the Metro construction work on priority section between IIT-Kanpur and Motijheel in Swaroop Nagar. This nine kilometre stretch will have nine Metro stations on the elevated track.

The work on the priority section is expected to be completed by November/December 2021. If the project is completed as per the plan, the Metro services will commence in the city between IIT-Kanpur and Motijheel.

Title: LU’s iconic Lal Baradari needs urgent restoration
Content:
In January, LU had appealed to state government to help save the heritage

Lucknow: The cracks in Lal Baradari on Lucknow University campus have widened following rains in January further endangering the iconic building.

“The building is crumbling as wild vegetation is damaging the plaster and bricks. The Lakhauri bricks are dropping like dry leaves,” said a faculty of ancient Indian history and archaeology department.

After seeing the photographs of the crumbling structure, Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) superintendent Manoj Saxena said the wall cracks needs to be stitched (a restoration technique of weaving in stones) immediately. “The rise in moisture in walls after spells of rain and sunshine create pressure which can lead to their collapse. If LU requests ASI director-general for restoration, we can take a call after inspection,” he added.

In January, LU had appealed state government to help save the heritage. “We want to renovate the building and have also appealed to alumni for aid,” said LU spokesperson Durgesh Srivastava.

The foundation of Lal Baradari, the only red stone building on campus, was laid by Nawab Ghaziuddin Haider Shah in 1814, Lucknow chronicler Yogesh Praveen told TOI.

The building which housed a bank, cafetaria was evacuated in 2015 after vaulted roof of a hall collapsed.

Title: AMC’s temporary pipeline fixes waste water
Content:
Aurangabad: Residents and activists have demanded a permanent fix to the malfunctioning pipeline joint at Avishkar Chowk in Cidco N-5 . Many alleged that frequent malfunctions in the pipeline impact water supply to the area.

On Monday, after the pipeline joint at Avishkar Chowk broke, water supply to Cidco N-5, N-6 and N-8 was completely disrupted. Residents received water supply after a delay of 16 to 18 hours.

This disruption in supply due to pipeline damage is not new. The pipeline had broken at the exact same spot two months ago. The disruption led to a water supply crisis for residents of Gulmohar Colony, Avishkar Colony, Mathura Nagar and the Ganesh Nagar wards of Cidco N-5, N-6 and N-8.

Civic activist Ashok Virkar said the pipeline disruption has been a problem for many years now. “Every time there is a malfunction of the pipeline, the AMC digs up the spot (which is along a busy market road) and thousands of litres of water get wasted. The AMC should put in place a permanent solution to the problem,” Virkar said.

The AMC has also failed to ensure barricades and warning signs are in place before works start. Three days after repairs started this week, the dig site was left unguarded — putting lives of motorists and pedestrians in jeopardy.

According AMC junior engineer at Cidco N-5 ESR, there is a heavy load on the joint as the water supplied to Cidco N-5, N-6 and N-8 passes through it. “We have fixed the line for now. The pit made for the repair will be filled and road will be restored. The water tank at Cidco N-8 is filled through this line that is why it has a pressure on it,” he said.

The AMC has carried out the repairs through maintenance funds that have been reserved for water supply. The water works department engineer said the civic body will need at least Rs 3 crore to implement a permanent solution along the entire line.

Title: Tests find presence of formalin in seafood sold in Karimedu market
Content:
Madurai: A spot test conducted at the Karimedu market in the city has revealed the usage of formalin to preserve seafood brought from states like Kerala and Andhra Pradesh. Around two tonne of seafood was destroyed as it was found unsafe for consumption.

A team of 15 officials from the food safety department led by designated officer Dr M Somasundaram conducted the test at the fish market with the help of lab analysts. The check, which began late on Friday night, lasted till the early hours of Saturday. The tests confirmed the presence of formalin in fish, prawns and crab.

Somasundaram said that ice supplied by factories nearby and the salt used in the process also tested positive for formalin. Samples drawn from seafood, ice and salt were sent for detailed analysis.

Food safety officials said they have been planning the check for at least two weeks. A screening was done in the market by a team of officials last week. Kits required for on the spot test were provided by an NABL accredited private laboratory based in Kalavasal.

Officials said that they checked all varieties of seafood and fresh water fish.

Karimedu is the biggest fish market in the city, from where seafood is distributed to various parts of Madurai and neighbouring districts.

Formalin, derived from formaldehyde, is commonly used by mortuaries to preserve bodies to prevent them from decaying. Fish traders sometimes illegally use it as a preservative, especially while transporting it to other states.

Food safety officials said that formalin can cause nausea, coughing and burning sensation in the eyes, nose and throat.

While they are short term issues, it can even cause cancer if consumed over a long period of time. In order to keep the fish fresh, it has to be maintained at less than 5 degrees Celsius. Formalin is mixed to increase shelf life.

Title: Colva beach works await central funds
Content:
Panaji: Though the Union ministry of tourism selected Colva beach under its ‘Iconic Tourist Sites Development Project’, the development of this popular coastal stretch in South Goa may be delayed as the ministry is yet to release funds.

Colva was the only beach among 11 other tourists destinations across the country selected under the scheme in August 2018.

Tourism secretary J Ashok Kumar said development works planned for Colva under the Centre’s Swadesh Darshan scheme are executed, but works planned under the Iconic Tourist Sites Development project are yet to commence.

Employment generation, development of local culture and occupations, beautification, infrastructure, provision of facilities and public amenities are some of the key objectives of the initiative. The development plan for Colva has been finalised after consulting locals and stakeholders.

The project raised the hopes of tourism stakeholders as it meant that the beach, which hardly has any facilities for tourists, will see some development.

In recent years, the flow of domestic tourists to Colva has increased, but there are barely any facilities for the visitors. Colva Creek continues to be polluted with increased footfall and commercial activities along the beach. “People treat it as a dustbin and release all kind of waste. Hotels release their sewage into it while panchayat has hardly any control over it,” said a stakeholder.

He said the beach is relatively clean because of beach cleaning by the tourism department, but the panchayat has to ensure that people don’t throw waste along the periphery of the beach, which remains uncollected and sometimes stuck in vegetations.

In 2015, a watchtower planned for the beach as part of the Colva coastal circuit development had to be dropped, after it was challenged in NGT for being within 200m CRZ.

Title: Activists caution on perils of fishing nets
Content:
Hyderabad: Animal activists in the city reached out to the forest department and asked them to take measures about the dangers of ghost nets and other fishing gear in city lakes.

An appeal has been made after a team of activists recently fished out huge quantities of fishing gear from Osman Sagar lake recently. “We have been conducting regular clean-up drives in the lakes and despite that the birds, which depend on these water bodies, are being threatened and killed,” said Pradeep Nair, founder of Animal Warriors India (AWI).

AWI has recently formed a search party to find a bird, a spoonbill, which was spotted with a plastic rope from a fishing net tangled around its beak at Osman Sagar.

“Our team tried to capture the bird and remove the plastic rope from its beak but we were not able to capture it as some parts of the lake are not accessible. We have appealed to the forest department asking them to write to the concerned authorities to take measures about the unattended fishing gear,” said Nair.

Apart from appealing to the foresters, the activists are also conducting awareness drives with the fishing community and organising regular clean-up drives to clean up the city’s lakes. One such drive has been planned at Osman Sagar on Sunday. Forest department official A Shankaran said, “We will write to concerned authority to take measures and educate the fishing community.”

Title: Man molests girl in Bassi, arrested
Content:
Jaipur: A 52-year-old man was arrested in Bassi police station area for attempting to rape a minor girl on Saturday. The accused called the girl to his house and molested her but ran away when he thought he was going to get caught. He was arrested after the girl told her parents about the incident. The girl is six-year-old.

Shiv Kumar Bhardwaj, SHO, Bassi police station told TOI, “The child’s parents work as labourers and when they were out for work , the accused who stayed in the same neighbourhood, called the girl to his house and molested her. When he thought someone was coming inside the house, he left the girl and fled from there.”

According to officials, if the accused had not heard a sound which made him scared of getting caught, there are chances that he would have assaulted the girl further

After this, the girl went back to her house and when the parents returned, she did not inform them immediately about the assault and the official said, “The child was hesitant in telling her parents but finally told them about the attempt to rape after which they registered a complaint with us.”

The cops immediately started an investigation and launched a search for the accused. “We took swift action and our teams started looking for the accused. We arrested him soon after the case was registered. We are questioning him and he is currently in police remand. Targeting such a young child is very serious matter and we caught him before he could get out of the area,” said the official.

A case under POCSO act was registered against the accused.

Title: Vadodara: 10 detained for rumour mongering
Content:
Work began to install 350 cameras on Saturday

VADODARA: At least 10 persons have been rounded up on Saturday for interrogation with regard to spreading rumours on the replacement of CCTV cameras in the city.

An offence was registered against unidentified persons at Cyber Crime police station in city on Friday for spreading rumours and causing panic among citizens.

Police had to later clarify that the cameras installed by a cable television distribution company had become defunct, which were being replaced by new cameras under the Smart City project.

Police officials said that the new cameras are of advanced technology as these will have features like night vision, high-definition, motion capture among others. Installation work of 350 cameras began on Saturday. Later 750 more cameras of similar technology will be installed.

“We have picked up eight to 10 people for questioning and three teams have also been formed for surveillance of social media and tracking down the original source of message that had spread the rumour,” said deputy commissioner of police Jaydeepsinh Jadeja.

Police sources said that the unprecedented violence in the national capital as well as in Khambhat has already spread panic among the citizens.

That is why law keepers are making efforts to contain all sort of rumours which can lead to any untoward incident in the city.

Besides keeping a tab on social media, foot patrolling was also held in different areas of the city on Saturday evening.

On Friday, panic was triggered by the rumour mills spreading false messages on social media that the cameras were being ‘removed’ ahead of a “Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) support rally” in the city.

Title: Hyd woman booked for child labour
Content:
Vijayawada: Nuzvid rural police have registered a complaint against a Hyderabad-based private television channel employee for engaging two minor girls as domestic help in her house.

An FIR has been filed against the woman by officials of Child Welfare Committee (CWC) of Krishna district, who have asked the police to investigate the matter and file a case under the Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986.

Child Welfare Committee chairman BVS Kumar said the two siblings, aged 12 years and 11 years, were studying at a child care institute in a village under Nuzvid mandal of Krishna district. “Their mother took them to their village during the Sankranti holidays, but the girls did not return even after the vacation ended. The child care centre authorities tried to contact the mother. After failing to reach her, they lodged a missing complaint with the Nuzvid rural police,” Kumar said.

The police traced the missing girls to Hyderabad and sent them back to the child care centre, who then informed the welfare committee.

During their interaction with CWC officials, the girls said they were employed for domestic work at the woman’s house. Based on the siblings’ statement, CWC directed Nuzvid rural cops to probe the matter and book the woman under the Child Labour Act.

Title: Lucknow: For them, being born on Feb 29 means extra special birthdays
Content:
Aishwarya Thapar

LUCKNOW: Akshata Kukreja celebrated her seventh birthday on Saturday, 28 years after she was born. Puzzled? Well, you’re not the only one. The Lucknow-based businesswoman became used to the flummoxed looks she got whenever she told people about this strange fact. Her reason: she was born on February 29 and gets to celebrate her birthday every four years. There are many like Kukreja in the city on February 29 and for them birthdays aren’t an annual ritual, but a quadrennial one. “This year I’ll be blowing out seven candles, instead of 28. I attend my friends’ birthday parties every year, but get to throw one of my own once in every four years,” she added. “I usually celebrate my birthday on February 28 and that is when most people send in their wishes. My five-year-old son says I am still a child who is celebrating her birthday. At the same time, my birthdays are extra special because they come once in four years,” added Akshata. For 24-year-old Parth Mishra being born on a leap day means exciting birthday gifts. “On my last birthday, my parents gifted me a laptop and a PlayStation on the one before that. This year’s gift is still a surprise,” he said. According to Mishra, one of the perks of being born on such a unique day is that nobody forgets his birthday. Then there are many ‘leap day babies’ or ‘leapsters’ who consider the unique date as a way to stay forever young. “I tell people I have just entered my teens and have years to act like a mature woman,” said LDA Colony resident Evon Francis, who celebrated her 60th birthday on Saturday. “A leap year birthday gives you a license to take your time while growing up,” she added. Another Lucknow resident Aishwarya Thapar , who turned 28 on Saturday, said that having a unique birthday has its share of problems. “When I was applying for a driver’s license at 18, officials wrote my birth date as February 28. I insisted on having my real date of birth registered in records, but they changed it,” said the marketing consultant.

Title: Will contest on all 115 seats in AMC polls alone: VBA
Content:
Aurangabad: The Vanchit Bahujan Aghadhi (VBA) that was associated with the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (MIM) in the Lok Sabha elections for winning the Aurangabad seat has made it clear that it will contest the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) polls without any alliance.

While the MIM had left the door open for a possible alliance, the VBA, during a press conference held on Saturday, said that it will contest on all 115 seats of the civic body all by itself.

Office-bearers of the VBA, including state general secretary Kishan Chavan, Nomadic Tribes (NT) organiser from Jamkhed Arun Jadhav and Aurangabad and Jalna districts’ observer Nitin Sonwane attended the press conference.

The VBA office-bearers were asked about the party’s plans and strategy in the wake of the forthcoming civic body polls. Responding to this, Sonawane said that VBA will not form an alliance with any party for the AMC elections and will contest on 115 seats on its strength. He also said that the party has already begun preparations for the same.

“A three-member planning committee has been appointed by VBA chief Babasaheb Ambedkar. The committee will soon announce dates and conduct interviews for the candidates who aspire to contest elections with VBA ticket,” Sonawane said. He said that so far 300 to 350 people have expressed interest to contest the elections with VBA ticket. He said that Ambedkar has given strict directives that there will be no alliance with any party either in AMC polls or in Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) polls.

Notably, the VBA-MIM alliance in 2019 Lok Sabha elections resulted in its only win in Aurangabad. Subsequently, differences had cropped up between the two parties and they separately contested the 2019 state assembly elections. However, VBA could not manage to bag any seat in the assembly polls.

Title: Army factory shut, 3k workers sent on leave after leopard spotted on campus
Content:
Bareilly: The ordnance clothing factory (OCF) in Shahjahanpur Cantonment temporarily shut operations on Saturday after a leopard was spotted in the premises. The big cat was initially spotted by security guards late on Friday night and later, its presence was confirmed by CCTV cameras installed on the factory campus. The OCF makes uniforms for the Indian Army.

Forest department was informed and officials placed a cage with a bait on the sprawling campus spread across 100 acres to capture the leopard. Foresters have also sought help of the Wildlife Trust of India (WTI) and installed eight camera traps to monitor the leopard’s movement. Besides, permission has been sought from higher authorities to tranquillize the big cat, if needed.

Nearly 3,000 employees at OCF Shahjahanpur unit were sent on leave after the leopard was spotted near the blanket manufacturing unit. An employee on the night shift captured a few pictures. Anurag Yadav, public relationship officer, OCF, said, “The leopard was spotted on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. After the night shift ended, work was called off on Saturday to ensure the safety of the employees. Forest department has deployed its personnel to capture the animal.”

It is not clear how the leopard strayed into the cantt area as the nearest forest, Khuthar range, is about 50 km from there. At the same time, the area’s green cover and presence of prey like stray cattle, dogs and nilgai provide the big cat an ideal habitat.

Last year in September, a leopard was spotted near Kendriya Vidyalaya school on several occasions. The forest department attempts to capture it failed and the animal disappeared after some time.

Now, MN Singh, sub divisional officer, believes that the factory leopard is the same as the one sighted near the school. “It seems it accidentally entered the factory premises. We have found its pugmarks and CCTV cameras also confirmed its presence. We are combing in the area and taking necessary action to ensure that it doesn’t harm anyone.”

Daksh Gangwar from WTI told TOI, “We have placed a cage on the campus and installed motion sensor camera traps to monitor the movement of the leopard. This animal is quite clever and had stayed away from the cage when we tried to capture it last year.”

Title: Kaimur police recover Rs 1.25 crore from car near Mohania toll plaza
Content:
SASARAM: Kaimur police recovered Rs1.25 crore in cash from a car at toll plaza on NH-2 near Mohania late on Thursday night. Two occupants of the car, including the driver, have been detained for further interrogation as police did not get any satisfactory reply for carrying the heavy cash. Kaimur SP Dilnawaz Ahamad confirmed the incident.

On getting information, a team of officials from the income-tax department also reached Mohania police station to inquire into the source of the cash recovered . According to sources, as a part of routine drive against liquor smuggling at the toll plaza on UP-Bihar border, police spotted the white car bearing the registration number of West Bengal on Thursday night.

During a through search, police found a tin box beneath the rear seat of the vehicle. After opening the box, police recovered Rs 1.25crore cash. Driver Shahnur Malik and occupants S K Zahir Hussian said the cash belonged to a Kolkata-based famous firm engaged in furniture and saree business.

The cash was collected from traders of Varanasi and other cities of UP and they were on the way to Kolkata. But following failure of the duo in furnishing any related documents in support of their claim, police seized the cash, car and detained them.

SP Dilnawaz said further action would be taken in this connection only after an inquiry report of the income-tax department is submitted.

Title: Smriti, Birla launch nutrition scheme for pregnant women
Content:
