Jaipur: Union women and child development minister Smriti Irani on Saturday launched ‘Suposhit Maa Abhiyan’, a scheme for pregnant women and adolescent girls, on pilot basis in Kota and Bundi on Saturday.

Smriti urged the state government to support the scheme which will provide nutritional support to pregnant women for 11 months taking on infant and female mortality rates. The campaign was jointly launched by Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla, who is MP from Kota. The programme will run for the next nine months.

“I have addressed the challenges Rajasthan is facing related to the health of pregnant women in the campaign. I am hopeful that the Rajasthan government will support the campaign initiated by our Prime Minister Narendra Modi,” said Smriti, while addressing a press conference after the launch. The programme will be funded by the government along with various civil society members.

Over 1,000 pregnant women and adolescent girls were chosen after screening over 5,000 such females in Kota. They have been chosen to receive a 17-kg kit which contains food items. Medical cards will also be given to monitor their health. The initiative is being supported by the Kota Grains and Seeds Merchants’ Association.

Birla said this initiative will be run with the help of civil society members and every family will adopt one beneficiary. Highlighting the importance of this campaign, Birla said this campaign will focus on providing the right nutrition to mothers which will eventually help their children.

Title: 1,200 students participate in tech-fest
Content:
Vadodara: The Sigma Group of Institutes organised two days tech fest including ‘Eminence’ and ‘Techshore’ on Wednesday and Thursday. Over 1 ,200 students including those pursuing their diploma and degree programmes presented their innovative projects during the tech fest.

The projects presented by students included 180° agriculture spray, artificial intelligence simulating humanoid assistant, elipti go exercise cycle, magical mirror, home automation, multiple search engine, salt car, modified bike, solar power water pumping system, abrasive jet machine, pedal power centrifugal pump. The college will be celebrating its annual event – Josh 2020 – wherein students will showcase their talent on Saturday.

Title: Swine flu: Six new cases in Meerut make total cases 77
Content:
Represenatative Image

MEERUT: With six new cases in Meerut, the total number of swine flu cases reached 77 here on Saturday. This came a day after 17 PAC jawans tested positive for the disease thereby sending shockwaves in the health department about the safety of a total of 370 jawans stationed in their battalion.

“Six new cases in Meerut tested positive in Meerut on Saturday making the count reach 77 here. While no new case of PAC jawan tested positive on Saturday, other locals were tested positive for the disease,” said Dr Rachna Tandon, Meerut district epidemiologist.

At least six persons have died in Meerut so far due to swine flu, even as the health department is taking all steps possible to to contain the disease.

Meerut chief medical officer Dr Raj Kumar said, “All the people who have come in contact of those detected with swine flu, have been given Tamiflu medicines. We have enough stock of medicines currently and if needed we will procure more medicines from the state authorities.”

All the private and government hospitals have been instructed to stay ready with isolation wards, which might be needed in case the number of swine flu patients increase further.

Title: Waste collection agency dumps debris instead of garbage
Content:
Aurangabad: Three corporators of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), along with the residents of the Padegaon area, caught the garbage collection agency red-handed while it was dumping construction debris instead of garbage at the Padegaon waste facility on Saturday.

The agency is paid on the basis of per tonne of waste collected and transported. In December, TOI had highlighted the unusual increase in the quantity of waste collected by the agency.

On Saturday morning, corporators Raosaheb Amle (Mitmita), Asha Nikalje (Bhimnagar North) and Subhash Shejwal (Padegaon), along with some residents, found two trucks consisting of construction debris and moorum (soil) brought in by the waste collection agency to be dumped at Padegaon dumping site.

According to Amle, they had raised the issue of malpractices by waste collection agency with the municipal commissioner in the past; however, no action was taken due to lack of evidence. “Now, since we have caught the agency staff dumping construction debris and moorum, we request the municipal commissioner to register an offence against the agency,” Amle said.

Amle said that the AMC should check the maximum amount of waste the vehicles can contain and, based on that, they should tally it with the weight of waste recorded by the agency. “This practice is not new as one can see the Padegaon waste filled with moorum, stones and bricks. We appeal to the municipal commissioner to make payment to the agency only after deducting the debris from the waste,” Amle said.

The waste-carrying trucks were then taken to the AMC office where they were emptied in the compound in the presence of mayor Nandkumar Ghodele and municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey.

Responding to the allegations made by the corporators, Pandey said that a committee has been formed to probe the matter. “Action will be taken based on the panel’s report. The previous records will be checked,” he said.

Biomedical waste rules violated

In an alarming revelation, the waste collection agency appointed by the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) was also found to be dumping tonnes of biomedical waste (BMW) or hospital waste containing syringes, bandages, dressings, used gloves and medicines at the Padegaon waste dumping facility. According to the Biomedical Waste Management Rules 2016, the BMW waste must not be mixed with solid waste and should be treated separately. The civic body has appointed a different agency for the purpose.

Later in the afternoon, it was found that the biomedical waste sent to be dumped at the Padegaon facility was collected from the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH). Subsequently, GMCH dean Kanan Yelikar and other officials were called by the AMC and directions were issued to them to comply with the BMW rules 2016.

Title: UP: Earthmovers pave way for Ram temple in Ayodhya
Content:
Temple construction panel head Nripendra Mishra in Ayodhya

AYODHYA: Heavy earthmoving machines rolled into the 67.7acre Ramjanmabhoomi premises in Ayodhya on Saturday afternoon, marking the beginning of construction of the Ram Mandir.

Chief priest of the makeshift temple, Acharya Satyendra Das, witness to JCB machines hurtling into the once disputed area, said, “It’s a joyous moment for Hindus as we are now free from 500 years of slavery.” Talking to TOI, Acharya Das said, “Machines have begun levelling land and clearing bushes and heavy thickets.”

The premises also houses more than 12 ancient temples, including Ram Janamsthan and Sita Rasoi, which are in ruins. No rituals are performed here since 1993, when land was acquired by the Centre. There’s still now word from the Trust whether these temples would be renovated or annexed into the greater temple design. Dr Anil Mishra, a trustee, said, “The Trust will decide the fate of these structures and on restarting worship.”

Ram Lalla idols will be shifted 150m from Garbh Griha towards the north-east during Ram Navami to pave way for temple. This was confirmed by sources in office of Ayodhya royal Bimlendra Pratap Mishra.

Title: Thiruvananthapuram: Businessman held for forging documents to inherit shopping complex
Content:
Baiju Vasanth

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The Fort police have arrested a prominent businessman in the city on charges of committing fraud to snatch ancestral property from his siblings. The police identified the accused as Baiju Vasanth , a resident of Artech City Meenakshi apartment complex at Vazhuthacaud . He is the owner of Ponnambalam Steel , a leading steel distributing company. The police have also arrested two document writers (vendors) who aided him in the fraud. They are Chandrakumar of Padasseri near Attukal and Sreekumar of Anayara. Their arrests were recorded at Fort police station here on Saturday.

The police said Baiju and his accomplices were arrested after an investigation into a complaint filed by his own sister, Binu Vasanth. Her complaint was that Baiju allegedly transferred a piece of ancestral property to his daughter’s name through forgery. Baiju is the eldest of three siblings. He has two sisters Binu Vasanth and Bindu Vasanth.

The property in question is a three-storey building opposite to Pazhavangadi Ganapathy Temple at East Fort. The building belonged to their grandmother and she had bequeathed the building to the three grandchildren. The building, which has been rented out to multiple business establishments, is worth at least Rs 5 crore.

Binu, in her complaint, alleged that the documents of the property were under the custody of her father until his death in 2014. Following his death, Baiju secured the custody of the documents, being the elder son. Since Bindu was settled abroad for years, she never cared to enquire about the status of the properties here. Recently, Binu learned that the ownership of the building has been transferred to the name of Baiju daughter following which she filed a complaint before the police.

The police found out in the investigation that Baiju snatched the property by executing an elaborate plan. He first hid the original deed of the property and placed an advertisement on newspapers that it has been lost. Then, he converted all ownership documents at village office and city corporation to his name by providing forged will, showing that he was the original heir of the property. The registration of the property to his daughter was done at Chala sub-registrar office on August 10, 2018.

According to a police officer who was part of the probe, Baiju had employed a meticulous design with the help of two document writers. The property was purchased by Baiju’s grandmother in 1982 from one Velayudhan Nair. When he forged the new document, he posed as the legal heir of Velayudhan Nair as the name of Nair’s son was also Baiju. The documents registered by Baiju’s grandmother in 1982 and later in 1984 to bequeath it to legal heirs were suppressed by Baiju to facilitate his plan. The posing as Nair’s son attracted impersonation charges apart from forgery, cheating and conspiracy against the three accused.

They were produced before the court and remanded in judicial custody.

Title: Telangana: 22-year-old held on charges of raping minor, probe underway
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: A 16-year-old girl is battling for life after she was allegedly raped and burnt by a man in Suryapet district. A case has been registered against the accused, 22, under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO) and section 376 (rape) of IPC.

The police has said after preliminary investigation that the girl had bought petrol before meeting the accused near her house on Friday night.

“According to the complaint filed by the girl’s parents, the man raped her and later set her ablaze. But prima-facie, we have discovered the man and the girl were in love. She recently learnt that he was marrying someone else and had called him to meet on Friday,” Suryapet police stated.

Police suspect that the girl wanted to threaten the accused of killing herself if he refused to marry her.

The incident is being investigated .

According to the police, it was the man who doused the fire and shifted the girl to the local hospital. She has suffered 50 per cent burns. The accused was taken into custody.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Brand Attingal College to hit food market
Content:
Government College, Attingal, will set up a counter on the campus to sell packaged organic rice powder

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The Government College , Attingal , is set to sell packaged organic rice powder by setting up a counter on the college campus. This is a result of an effort spanning several months that turned a piece of barren land on the college campus to a rich paddy field . The harvest festival titled ‘ Kalalaya Kathirolsavam ’ held on Friday was a huge hit.

The NSS unit, students, teachers, other staff members and former students of the college harvested paddy they grew in the land near the college premises. The farming was started in November after teachers and NSS volunteer chipped in for the expenses.

Around 96 cents of barren land near the college was made ready for farming under the leadership of principal V Manikatan Nair and NSS programme officers Sarun S G and K Gopakumar. The students dug up a pond near the field to source water for agriculture. Activities such as planting of saplings were held with the support of Krishi Bhavan at Attingal. In adding to paddy, farming of banana and tapioca too has been started at the campus.

“The result of farming was exciting. Of the total 96 cents of farm land, we got 80kg of rice from just 14 cents. Harvest will be held in other areas in the coming weeks. We are planning to powder the rice and sell it under the brand name of Government College Attingal. We hope organically produced rice will have good demand. We also have vegetables ready for sale. The money will be used to invest in farming,” said principal V Manikantan, who is set to retire by March end.

The principal said he hope that the students will spread farming to more areas. “With the initiative, we are able to make students familiar with our culture of farming. Students themselves water the farm in the morning and evening. By diverting their energy to such productive activities, the college has a peaceful and productive environment,” the principal said. The college has a solar plant, a mini forest, medicinal garden, among others. “The solar plant installed using the fund of Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan has helped the college in reducing power bill from around Rs 4,000 to Rs 400,” the principal said.

Title: Man, 35, booked for sexually harassing woman at restroom
Content:
Bareilly: A man has been held for attempting to outrage the modesty of a married woman in a restaurant situated in the outskirts of Bareilly city. On Friday night, the woman’s husband had thrown a party on the occasion of his birthday where a 35-year-old man from Shahjahanpur district allegedly assaulted her while she had gone to restroom.

The accused was immediately held by woman’s husband with the help of restaurant staff and later handed over to police. An FIR was registered against him under IPC sections 354 (attempt to outrage the modesty of a woman), 342 (wrongful confinement) and 511 (attempting to commit punishable offences with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment) at Izzatnagar police station.

SHO Izzatnagar KK Verma said, “The complainant and his friends were partying at a restaurant’s bar where the accused Navjot Singh allegedly attempted to sexually assault complainant’s wife and even tried to confine her in the restroom. Navjot was also partying in the restaurant and was high on alcohol at the time of incident. After receiving a complaint, we immediately took Navjot in our custody and filed an FIR against him.”

Title: ‘Stage’ set for techies to hog the limelight
Content:
Hyderabad: Away from apps, websites, programming languages, city techies are donning a new role — taking to theatre. Over the weekend, many IT professionals will be seen on stage in plays that boast of an all-techie cast. Promoted by cultural department, the plays will be staged at Ravindra Bharathi and presented by Manch Theatre .

“We are building a bridge between techies and theatre. Over the last four years, we have been roping in IT professionals to showcase their passion on stage,” said Hari Krishna, director, department of culture.

On Saturday, a play ‘Khud Ki Khushi’ was performed in Hindi. The play is about a woman’s struggle at different stages of life and her battle with domestic violence and mental health.

Director Vamsi Ramachandruni, who works with an IT firm, said, “We are great at multi-tasking and what better way to challenge yourself than on stage where there are no retakes, and everything is live.” He says theatre has always been his passion. Miti Shah, one of the actors, says that it is the need to express herself that made her foray into theatre.

On Sunday, Telugu play ‘Bheem’ will be staged. Director Harsha Chakilam, also a techie, said he has been pursuing theatre for six years. The play is based on the life of tribal leader Komaram Bheem. Actor Saikrishna said, “The play will focus on the plight of tribals during their liberation struggle.”

Title: VAT hiked on petrol, diesel
Content:
Vijayawada: The Value Added Tax ( VAT ) on petrol and diesel was increased by 76 paisa and 1.07 extra per litre, ,respectively, on Saturday. The new rates will come into force from Sunday.

The Andhra Pradesh government, on January 29, had made changes to the VAT tariffs by removing the fixed charge. Tariffs was revised from 31% on petrol to 35.2% and from 22.25% to 27% on diesel. By increasing the tariff, the government removed fixed charges of 2 per litre. TNN

Title: Saharanpur shows how to end bitter Sikh-Muslim feud
Content:
MEERUT: Six years after Saharanpur witnessed the worst-ever riots between Muslims and Sikhs over a land dispute, the communally sensitive district has set an example on how to iron out differences and arrive at a solution with representatives of both communities sitting on a table and amicably resolving the matter.

The matter erupted in 2014 when the Sri Guru Singh Sabha Gurdwara committee started constructing an extension to the gurdwara on a plot it had bought. Members of the minority community objected to the move, claiming that a mosque once had once stood at the spot. It triggered one of worst communal clashes on Ambala Road, resulting in three deaths while an entire market was gutted because of arson. More than 200 people were booked.

Both parties went to court after that. However, Wednesday witnessed something unprecedented. While Sikh representatives agreed to buy a plot of land in a minority-dominated area and construct a mosque there, Muslim representatives reciprocated by agreeing to perform kar seva in the expansion plan of the gurdwara committee.

“I lost everything in that riot and suffered a loss of nothing less than a crore. It took years for me to rebuild my life but there was always a fear that the unresolved dispute might flare up again sometime in the future. With this settlement , that fear and uncertainty has been put to rest,” said DS Chawla, owner of an electronic items showroom.

Mohammad Danish Kamal, who lost all his stock to arson and suffered a loss close to Rs 8 lakh at that time, is relieved by the development but with a pinch of salt. “It’s good that the solution has forever killed any possibility of a flare-up in future but I personally feel there should not have been the money angle in this settlement. We have no dearth of mosques in our region. It would have been better if Sikhs were allowed to extend their premises on the land without any resistance,” added Kamal.

Gurpreet Bagga, state unit president, Akali Dal, who initiated the peace process, said, “This bitterness had to end and the only solution that came to my mind was to sit down on the negotiation table and it worked. We approached district and police administration who happily mediated, and after six sittings, Gurdwara Singh Committee proposed to buy a separate land measuring 200 square yards for Muslims in a minority-dominated area and build a mosque in lieu of an agreement on withdrawing of cases from both sides, apart from Muslims abandoning the claim on the land adjacent to the gurdwara.”

Dinesh Kumar P, SSP, Saharanpur, along with former DM Alok Pandey played a constructive role in the settlement, said, “It is indeed a historical development that took place with the constructive role of the district administration, the gurdwara committee and Muslim organizations to bring about peace. Now, we will ensure that both sides keep their word and work in the direction.”

Muharram Ali, representative from Muslim side, said, “This is indeed a positive development and we have agreed to help by offering kar seva to build the extension of the gurdwara for our Sikh brothers.”

Rinku Khalsa, 43, who received a bullet in the stomach during the riots, is quite upbeat. “God has been kind that I lived to see this day and development.”

Title: CCTV cameras with AI software will help keep tab on criminals
Content: Vadodara: New cameras with advanced technology will help police department in not only issuing e-challans for traffic rule violations, but also for quick detection of crime and keeping a tab on history-sheeters and anti-social elements in the city. Artificial intelligence facial recognition software of home department of state government will be first tried in the city as the software will be synced with all CCTV cameras. Senior police officials said the software will alert the control room if a history-sheeter on the run is captured by the cameras. “We have photo records of all convicts and accused in our e-GujCop data which will be synced with the software. So if any of those persons, who are wanted, are seen in the CCTV cameras, the system will pop-up an alert,” said police commissioner Anupam Singh Gahlaut. He added that this will also help in finding missing persons. Gahlaut told TOI that this software will not be used to keep a tab on innocent citizens. “The software will have photos available only in our data and no other citizens’ photo will be fed into the system,” he said. He added that photos of those persons acquitted by the court will not be there in the software. The software will become operational on Monday. tnn

Title: Kept in cell meant for death row convicts, treated like a terrorist: Azam
Content:
Rampur: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, wife Tazeen Fatma and son Abdullah Azam were sent to judicial custody till March 20. The trio, who were brought from Sitapur jail, appeared before a local court on Saturday under heavy police security. Khan, who surrendered in a Rampur court on Wednesday and was jailed in a case of forgery, was swiftly shifted to Sitapur prison along with his legislator wife and son on Thursday.

The three had filed an application for surrender in 47 cases registered against them throughout the district.

Outside the court, Azam alleged that he was being mistreated in the jail.

“Though I am a member of the Lok Sabha, I am not receiving any facilities in the prison as per the jail manual. Jail authorities have kept me in a British-era cell where the death penalty prisoners were kept. I don't know why they are treating me like a terrorist,” he said.

Azam claimed that he was served food prepared in jail’s bhandara (kitchen). Asked how he passed his day in jail, Khan said, “I read autobiographies of great freedom fighters. I am currently reading books written on socialist leader Ram Manohar Lohia.”

His wife and Rampur MLA Tazeen Fatma was brought in a wheelchair. In the courtroom, she moved towards the judge’s podium and informed him that she was unable to travel long because a recent spinal surgery and produced her medical certificates. Judge Dhirendra Kumar Kamboj nodded and took note of it.

The trio has been jailed for forging two birth certificates of Abdullah Azam, who allegedly also gave a wrong date of birth while filing his nomination for the assembly elections in 2017. Abdullah was elected MLA from Rampur. However, his election was set aside by Allahabad high court in December last year. He has challenged the decision in Supreme Court where trial is pending. On Thursday, the UP Legislative Assembly also disqualified him as a member and declared his seat Suar in Rampur as vacant.

Khan is facing several police cases, including those related to grabbing of land. Authorities claimed certain portions of his Mohammad Ali Jauhar University, established by Khan in 2006, is built on government land. The encroachments were demolished recently.

On July 29 last year, Azam Khan was declared a “land mafia” by the Rampur administrative authorities following a series of cases of land grab against him. The Enforcement Directorate also initiated an inquiry into the alleged money laundering charges related to donations received by Khan’s university from abroad.

Title: State BJP chief targets Sena over city renaming issue, loan waiver
Content:
CLEARED SKHER

Aurangabad: State BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Saturday raked up the pending demand for renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar.

Patil, who was a day-long tour of the city ahead of the civic elections, said technical issues must be addressed by the government to pave way for the renaming. The tomb of Aurangzeb, the last of the strong Mughal emperors, is located in Khuldabad near Aurangabad. The city gets its name from the ruler.

The old demand of renaming Aurangabad has been repeatedly raised by BJP, especially after its former ally Shiv Sena joined hands with Congress-NCP to retain power in Maharashtra. The BJP has also raised the issue during different meetings of the Aurangabad municipal corporation. It has blamed Shiv Sena for not doing enough to rename the city while in power.

Speaking with the media on the sideline of meetings with local BJP workers ahead of upcoming election, Patil said BJP has bright chances in the polls. “If we lead vigorous and organised poll campaign, our party can create wonders in AMC polls. I am personally holding discussions with different party workers to evolve a strategy,” he said.

Criticising the state government, Patil said the law and order in the state has gone for a toss. “Crime against women is on the rise. The farming community is still in distress, despite the much-hyped loan-waiver scheme,” he said.

Scaling up attack on the loan waiver scheme, BJP chief said the state government has withheld the list of beneficiary farmers citing the code of conduct for polls of certain gram panchayats. “Going by the similar logic, the state government must roll back new legislations it has introduced, especially related to election of village-head and Agricultural Produce Market Committees. We have already raised the issue with Maharashtra Governor,” Patil said.

Title: ‘Need for awareness on gender sensitization ’
Content:
Madurai: Though the country is advancing as a society and also making strides in education, there is a need to create awareness on gender sensitization and prevention of sexual harassment in work places, said Chief Justice of the Madras high court, Amreshwar Pratap Sahi.

The Chief Justice who inaugurated a training programme on gender sensitization and internal complaints committee here on Saturday, said, “Any complaint brought to the attention of the internal complaints committee in the courts, should be investigated well and ensure that the victim, complainant or witnesses do not have the fear of being harassed and that fair action is taken.”

He said that our history is evident of how women in our society were respected, protected and given priority in the community. Workplaces have to be made safer for women, and it is their basic right, the Chie Justice said.

Sessions including judicial pronouncements on sexual harassment cases by retired judge S Vimala, sexual harassment complaints committee by advocate Aparna Bhat were held.

Inspector general of police, south zone, K P Shanmugarajeswaran spoke on complaint process and sexual offences and punishments in IPC, investigations in sexual offences. Justice N Nisha Banu, chairperson, GSICC, Madras high court welcomed.

Title: Shaurya Sthal to have 100-ft tricolour
Content: Former Rajya Sabha MP Tarun Vijay on Saturday said that the Uttarakhand war memorial in Cheer bagh will have one of the highest — 100 feet —tricolours in the state for which the work has already started.

Title: Maharashtra: Farmer ends life the day his son recites poem on suicide
Content:
Representative image.

NASHIK: Malhari Batule , a 32-year-old farmer from the Pathardi taluka of Ahmednagar district , allegedly ended his life by consuming poison on Thursday night.

Ironically, the same morning, Batule’s son — a Class III student at a government school — had recited a short poem on the topic of farmers’ suicide on the occasion of Marathi Bhasa Day.

The young boy had highlighted the need for farmers to desist from taking such a harsh step, as it serves no purpose.

The Pathardi police sources said Batule was rushed to a hospital in Ahmednagar city for treatment, but he later succumbed. At present, the police have registered a case of accidental death.

“We think the farmer may have ended his life as he had a substantial amount of loan to repay,” the police sources said.

Police insiders added that the farmer had taken a loan of more than Rs 20 lakh and had bought a truck. Moreover, it was also his responsibility to repay a loan of Rs 8 lakh that his father had taken to buy a tractor.

“As per the initial information that we have, the farmer was facing a financial crisis. He was finding it difficult to repay two loan installments,” police sources said.

As per the rules, the police and the local revenue department would carry out separate probes to ascertain whether the farmer ended his life purely due to agrarian crisis. The reports would be submitted to the district administration panel to asses whether the bereaved family is eligible for monetary compensation from the government.

A pall of gloom had descended on the Bharajwadi village after the villagers came to know of the incident. The deceased farmer is survived by his wife, three children and parents.

Title: Telangana government gives postings to awaiting IAS officers
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: The Telangana government on Friday issued postings to some of the awaiting IAS officers . While chief secretary Somesh Kumar has been given additional charge as the principal secretary of mines and geology department, finance department special secretary D Ronald Rose was placed in full additional charge as the director of mines and geology department. Jayesh Ranjan, who was holding both the posts, has been relieved.

Anita Rajendran has been posted as secretary to the animal husbandry department, B Vijiendra as special secretary to transport, roads and buildings department, MRM Rao as transport commissioner relieving Sunil Sharma of the full additional charge, and M Prashanti posted as joint secretary to environment and forest department.

Title: City feels pinch of packaged water makers’ stir
Content:
Madurai: The indefinite strike by packaged drinking water manufacturers has started affecting Madurai residents with regular suppliers restricting the number of 20 litre cans they can deliver to one at a time.

While only the 72 old wards of the corporation have protected drinking water supply through taps, the remaining 28 wards depend solely on private players to supply potable water.

With summer setting in, the groundwater levels have gone down and salinity of the water has also increased. Since the total dissolved solids (TDS) count in water in many parts of the city is high, many people depend on packaged water for their drinking needs.

There are about 60 registered packaged water manufacturers in Madurai who supply water to about 60,000 houses every day, apart from private firms, offices and even hospitals. ``I didn’t know that the strike was on in Madurai and was shocked when the supplier told me about a short supply and that he could give me only one 20 litre can on Saturday,’’ said S Meenakshi of Anna Nagar. As she uses the water for all her needs including cooking, she bought a 10 litre water can of a specific brand for Rs 50 as a precautionary measure.

Many of the shops which sold packaged drinking water downed shutters on Saturday to avoid people coming in.

“I have a small stock but that is for my regular customers, and that too I am giving only a can per day,’’ said Pandiarajan, who supplies water in Anna Nagar. Suresh, another supplier, said they would have to switch off their phones on Sunday due to the big demand, which they would not be able to meet because of dwindling stocks. A private firm in Chokkikulam asked its employees to bring their own drinking water from home on Saturday due to the cut in number of cans by its supplier on Saturday. “This is a big problem as most of us also depend on the same water for our drinking water needs at home,’’ said K Venkateswari, an office-goer. The high court in a recent order had asked all packaged drinking water units to get NOCs from the PWD, directorate of food safety and administration and directorate of town planning and then apply for clearance from the Tamil Nadu pollution control board to continue operations. This has affected all manufacturers.

R Rajasekharan of Tamil Nadu Packaged Drinking Water Manufacturers Association said there are 1,689 registered manufacturing units in the state out of which only 561 had ground water clearance. “Each district in the state has supplies of about 20 lakh litres of water on an average a day. This has come to a standstill,’’ he said. They could start manufacturing as usual if the government gives them an assurance, he added.

Title: SCR introduces QR code for quick booking of tickets
Content:
Aurangabad: The South Central Railway (SCR) on Saturday introduced Quick Response (QR) code for speedy booking of general tickets through Unreserved Ticking System (UTS) on mobile app. The measure has been introduced in the wake of increasing popularity of UTS app among passengers, chief public relations officer of SCR Ch Rakesh said.

“QR codes have been created and displayed at all railway stations. The new initiative facilitates the passengers to book tickets through UTS on mobile App within the station premises and also from the areas within the vicinity of 1 km radius from the station by scanning the QR code of a particular station,” he said.

SCR general manager Gajanan Mallya has appealed to all the passengers to avail the user friendly UTS on mobile App and QR code for purchasing the tickets which he said will help them to avoid standing in long queues at stations. Mallya said that the move is time saving.

SCR authorities said the UTS on mobile App has been progressively getting extensive patronage from rail users across all divisions in the zone. UTS on mobile app is one of the major digital avenues implemented by the SCR in taking forward the digitization of railway services for the convenience of passengers.

The SCR has also introduced a new feature — Automatic Ticket Vending Machines (ATVMs) — to improve speed and minimize the transaction time while purchasing unreserved general tickets, platform tickets and season tickets.

“All ATVMs are enabled with fast booking features. With new value addition, tickets can be purchased in any ATVM with just two clicks instead of seven clicks required earlier,” SCR authorities said.

As per the new feature, a passenger can select fast booking field with the first click. Then top 30 frequently used destinations will appear on the screen. The passenger has to select the required destination with the second click and then the required ticket will be generated.

“Fast booking of tickets in two clicks is a major value addition in ATVM application which will reduce the transaction time in selection of particulars,” SCR authorities said.

Title: Gangster’s aides held for making extortion bid
Content:
Vadodara: Crime branch sleuths arrested two aides of history-sheeter and murder convict Gova Rabari for trying to extort Rs1 crore for development of a land located at Bil village near the city.

Accused Anup alias Pappu Gadhvi and Lalji Bharwad had tried to stop construction work on a plot of land on January 17 claiming that they too had interests in it. They were arrested on Friday. On Saturday, a local court remanded Gadhvi and Bharwad in police custody till Sunday evening. Cops said that on Monday, they will also initiate process to get Rabari’s custody.

The land was bought in 2001 by Dr Jayesh Patel, who is currently in Vadodara Central Jail, for allegedly raping a nursing student of Parul University in 2016. A family member of Patel had submitted a complaint to police based on which an offence of extortion, criminal trespass, criminal intimidation and criminal conspiracy was registered against Gadhvi, Bharwad, Rabari and two unidentified persons.

On January 17, Gadhvi and Bharwad reached the site and tried to stop construction work. The developer made Gadhvi talk to Patel’s daughter – Parul when he claimed that he too had interest in the land. On the phone call, Gadhvi told Parul to give Rs1 crore and settle the issue. He also asked her to talk to her father to meet Rabari in the jail for settlement. According to the complaint, Gadhvi also mentioned of facing dire consequences if Rs1 crore was not sent. On February 20, Parul and her brother Devanshu met Patel in the jail to talk about Gadhvi’s extortion bid. Patel had then submitted an application in this regard to police. “The accused mentioned that they had dealing with the previous owner of the land and held power of attorney, but it is suspected that the documents could be fake,” said a police official.

Title: Residents dumping garbage into channel to get notice
Content:
Madurai: The Madurai Corporation will issue caution notice to residents, who dump garbage into the Kiruthumal channel , in order to curb pollution caused in the channel.

Commissioner S Visakan instructed his officials to start sending notices to houses of residents, who dump the garbage after they inspected the channel at various points on Saturday. Officials said they walked along the channel and covered at least 9km.

An official said the civic body is planning to seek funds from state and central governments to revive the channel. Already, it has proposed to treat sewage water carried by the channel at Chinthamani. The treated water would be let into a small tank there. At present, the civic body is in the process of preparing a detailed project report to revive the channel.

The centuries-old channel, which irrigated large tracts of land, is now reduced to mere sewage carrier. The channel, which was fed water from the streams of Nagamalai, starts at Achampattu before it drains into Gundaru on the city outskirts. It gets polluted all along its 13km stretch as people litter garbage and let sewage into it. Corporation too lets untreated sewage from its pumping stations, the official said.

“Already, a survey was conducted to identify residents letting sewage directly into the channel and all the outlets have been closed,” another official said.

He added that some of the pumping stations let untreated sewage water into water bodies and channels including Kiruthumal channel. It is due to the increased load faced by them. The commissioner has ordered engineering officials to increase capacity of pumping stations by constructing extra wells. Soon, the issue will be addressed.

Title: Two cops among three arrested on charges of ‘kidnapping informer’
Content:
Bareilly: Two constables, Akshay Uppal and Nikhil Pawar, were among three persons arrested for allegedly kidnapping a 22-year-old man in UP’s Moradabad and “demanding ransom money from his family to let him free”. Pawar’s cousin Ashish was also arrested. The two constables have been suspended, police said on Saturday.

Moradabad man Salman, said to be a police informer, was asked to reach near a canal from where he was allegedly kidnapped by the cops who later informed his family that special operations group (SOG) team had taken him into custody to probe a matter. They later demanded Rs 2 lakh in lieu of releasing him. According to police sources, Salman used to provide information to the two constables.

Notably, Thakurdwara circle officer Vishal Yadav said that Salman was a resident of Ganinagar under Mudhapandey police station and was part of a baggage lifting gang. “During investigation, Salman confessed that he had been involved in stealing bags of train passengers and committed several thefts near Gorakhpur. The government railway police and railway protection force have been informed and we asked them to trace his criminal record. But, we have no concrete proof against him yet,” Yadav, the deputy superintendent of police (DSP), said.

According to police, Uppal had come in contact with Salman about six months ago after he raided a gambling site. Though, he didn’t get any success, he found a mobile phone from the crime scene which eventually led him to Salman. Over the period, Uppal developed a good rapport with him as the latter became his informer. Salman used to give him important leads and based on his tip off, Uppal managed to crack several cases. Salman had reportedly informed him about his nexus in the Gorakhpur railway station area.

“On Thursday, Uppal learnt that Salman had just returned from Gorakhpur after committing a theft and had money. He shared the information with his colleague Pawar and hatched a plan to recover money from Salman by threatening him in the name of SOG. Their plan, however, didn’t work,” the DSP said.

Uppal is a native of Muzaffarnagar while Pawar and his cousin belong to Baghpat district. After “kidnapping” Salman, the trio took him around in a moving car for two hours and let him go only when they learnt that they were on the radar of other cops. Before leaving home, Salman had told his family that he was going to meet Uppal.

Police arrested the trio from Bhojpur area and lodged an FIR under sections 364A (kidnapping for ransom) and 392 (punishment for robbery) of IPC. “Both the policemen have been suspended and a report against them has been sent to police headquarters,” the DSP added.

Title: House crumbles, falls into stream in Chukkuwala
Content: House falls into stream in Chukkuwala: A house located in the slum area of Chukkuwala locality in Dehradun crumbled and fell into a nearby stream on Saturday. However, no casualty was reported. According to the residents, the incident took place at 4 am. “Many household items like refrigerator have also been lost. We have incurred a loss of about Rs 10 lakh. My husband and son are daily wage labourers while I work as a maid,” said Aruna, owner of the house.

Title: Expo Axis ’20 showcases India’s modern military might
Content:
Various models of Indian defence ecosystem were on display on the 2nd day of AXIS ’20, the annual technical fe... Read More

Nagpur: School and college students got a glimpse of the Indian defence ecosystem on the 2nd day of AXIS ’20, the annual technical festival of Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology (VNIT), on Saturday.

The two-day exhibition features models by ten organizations. The main attraction of the exhibition is Indro 3.0, India’s tallest autonomous humanoid robot with high speed microcomputer especially designed for real-time communication and human interaction.

The Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO), in association with the National Remote Sensing Centre (NRSC), informed visitors about rockets, space missions, Mars orbiter mission and Chandrayan 1 and 2.

The artillery of the Indian Army is on display in association with the National Cadet Corps (NCC). Besides the exhibition of arms and ammunition, cadets briefed students about the training activities and weapon data.

Miniature replicas of INS Vikramaditya and a submarine by the Indian Navy attracted large crowds.

Senior draftsman Anil Suryavanshi said, “It was a mesmerizing sight. If we nurture kids from a tender age, they will bloom when they grow up.”

Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) demonstrated its research in nuclear power technology. Visitors got an opportunity to experience augmented and virtual reality at the exhibition with the aid of global logic, a digital product engineering services company.

RC aircraft models and drones have been displayed as well.

The Indian Air Force has displayed replicas of aircraft and fighter jets that are piloted by professionals. A display of extrusions, shells and assembly components of weapons is being demonstrated by Ordnance Factory while explosives like the multimode hand grenade is being shown by Solar Industries.

Student Rohan Singh was delighted after seeing the impressive infrastructure of the defence sector. He said, “It was an amazing experience to witness models of drones, aeroplanes, fighter jets, arms and ammunition and to get familiarized with the work of our brave armed forces.”

Apart from the exhibition, students participated in recreational activities like bubble play, paradeigma, robocup, paintball, manual robotics and aquahunt among others.

(Reporting by Manshika Vaikkath)

Title: Trial nod granted keeping Bihar polls in view: Kanhaiya Kumar
Content:
Former JNU Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar (File photo)

PATNA: CPI functionary and former JNU Students’ Union (JNUSU) president Kanhaiya Kumar has questioned the timing of the prosecution order against him passed by the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government in connection with a four-year-old sedition case, saying it was done deliberately ahead of Bihar assembly election.

“The idea is to divert the attention of people from important issues like falling gross domestic product (GDP). Instead of dip in GDP, the focus is on my prosecution,” Kanhaiya told TOI over phone from Ranchi.

He said though the case dates back to 2016, the chargesheet against him was filed two years later. “According to rules, the chargesheet should have been filed within 90 days. However, it was done two years later in 2018 when I was preparing for parliamentary election. Now the prosecution order has come just before the Bihar election,” Kanhaiya said.

“I want a speedy trial in a fast-track court. The country should know the truth. Conclusion of this case is important because people will come to know how some people are playing patriotism card for their political benefits,” Kanhaiya said.

Title: Vizhinjam fishermen protest over compensation package
Content:
Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The works of construction of breakwater for Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited was disrupted here on Saturday after the local fishermen, led by the Vizhinjam parish council members, laid siege to the worksite. The agitation was a protest measure against the state government for failing to keep the promise of a compensation package announced for the local fishermen, whose livelihood would be affected once the port commences its operations.

Around 10am on Saturday a group of fishermen led by 26 members of the Vizhinjam parish council reached the worksite and stopped all ongoing construction works. They demanded the labourers to vacate the worksite and then laid siege to the site by blocking the road leading to the port by placing their boats across the road. The agitation continued till 2pm until the representatives of Adani Group who are carrying out the works and the officials of revenue department despatched by the district collector came to the spot and held talks with the fishermen. The fishermen decided to call off the agitation after they were promised a meeting with the district collector on March 11, when their grievances will be heard.

Speaking to TOI, parish council vice-president S Muthappan, who himself is a fisherman, said that the government was yet to fulfil the promise of providing a compensation package to the fishermen, especially those who went for fishing in motorized boats fitted with outboard engines.

“When the works of the port commenced, the government promised each boat four litres of kerosene per day considering the extra kilometres we have to travel for fishing once the port starts functioning. But, this promise was never kept. Initially each boat was given 80 litres per month, which is around 2.5 litres per day. But, this too stopped one year ago,” Muthappan said adding that this was only a token protest and a massive agitation would be launched if the meeting on March 11 failed.

The fishermen had launched a similar agitation in October 2017, during the initial stages of port construction, for the delay in distribution of compensation package.

Title: MP: Three arrested for 10-yr-old’s murder, prime accused admits sodomising boy
Content:
The three accused at the Shahjehanabad police station

BHOPAL: A day after the decomposed body of a 10-year-old boy was found near the railway tracks in Sanjeev Nagar , Shahjehanabad police on Saturday arrested three accused on charges of abduction and murder of the minor.

The trio had allegedly lured the boy on the pretext of a picnic and then taken him to a forest area near Sanjeev Nagar where they drank together and took bath in a pond. While returning, the prime accused in the case sodomised the boy. When he protested, the accused allegedly strangled him to death as he feared that the boy would reveal the incident to his family.

The other two accused had returned home on their bike prior to the murder, but they did not reveal about the picnic to the police.

SP (North) Shailendra Singh Chouhan said that the accused have been identified as Arun Yadav , 26, a resident of Nariyalkhera in Gautam Nagar, his cousin brother Gopal Yadav alias Lalu, 19, a resident of Shahjehanabad, and Amardeep alias Mattu Yadav, 21, a resident of Shahjehanabad. All the three accused work as daily wage workers in the BMC.

SP Chouhan said that during the investigation, the boy’s family members told police that the deceased was acquainted with Lalu and used to visit his father’s dairy at Ahir Mohalla near the house to watch and play with cattle. He was last seen at the dairy till 2 pm on February 22. Acting on this information, police detained Lalu and interrogated him. SP Chouhan said that Lalu told police that he along with Arun and Mattu had taken the boy to a pond near Sanjeev Nagar on their bike. Before reaching the spot, they purchased a bottle of liquor. As the road to the pond was bumpy in the forest area, two of them reached the pond by their bike while Arun and the minor boy reached on foot. The three accused consumed alcohol at the pond and then took bath.

SP Chouhan said that while returning, Lalu and Mattu went on the bike and Arun along with the minor boy followed them on foot. Arun revealed that he sodomised the boy near the railway tracks. But when he started shouting in pain, Arun strangulated him. At that time, Lalu and Mattu, who were waiting for them on the bike across the railway tracks on road, called him repeatedly. Arun tried to mislead them by saying that the boy had returned with them.

SP Chouhan said that Arun went absconding since then. He is a drunkard and has not gone to his home for the past three years so police were not able to find him initially. He was not even reporting to work. Lalu and Mattu too concealed the information that they had gone to the pond with the minor boy. When police detained Lalu and Mattu, cops found that Arun had given his ATM card to a friend and was enquiring with him about the salary credited in his account. When police found Arun’s friend, he too was detained.

Arun has confessed of sodomising the boy and murdering him.

Title: Paying ward at BD Pandey hosp closes due to scarcity of nurses
Content:
Pithoragarh: The paying ward of BD Pandey District Hospital, Pithoragarh, remained closed on Sunday due to the shortage of nursing staff.

The hospital, which is the biggest in a district with a population of around 5 lakh, has 19 posts of nurses, of which four are currently not filled. Of the 15 nurses that are currently working, six are on leave. Chief medical superintendent of the hospital HS Kharayat said, “Six nurses have been on leave for the last couple of days. As for the remaining staff, they often have to work on Sundays and take the compensatory offs towards the end of the month. It is because of this sudden shortage in nursing staff that the paying ward has been closed for the weekend. We expect it will function smoothly again from Monday.”

Moreover, contracts of an ENT doctor and an orthopedic ended on Saturday and were not extended. The hospital did not have an ENT doctor or an orthopedic, so it hired two specialists on contract. The contract of Dr Ramesh Punera, ENT, was valid from March 1 2019 to February 29 this year. Similarly, the contract of Dr HS Mehata, orthopedic, has also expired and not been extended.

“A proposal has been sent to the government to extend the contracts of these two doctors but no information has been received. We hope the extension is approved soon,” added Kharayat.

The district hospital has 120 beds, of which 15 are chargeable and make up the paying ward. Patients can take these if they want to avail extra facilities. The beds in the paying ward cost Rs 146 per day. The paying ward is mostly full.

Title: Notorious criminal shot in encounter, critical
Content:
Bareilly: History-sheeter Karan, alias, Chotu — wanted in over dozen cases of robbery, road holdup, murder, etc, and carrying a bounty of Rs 15,000 — was arrested after a brief encounter in Maanpur village under Cantonment police station on Saturday night.

The accused sustained a bullet injury in his right leg. He was rushed to the district hospital, where his condition deteriorated as his blood pressure dipped to a critical level. He was referred to the mission hospital, said police, adding that "he is critical".

The accused was absconding after killing constable Anirudh Yadav posted at the Cantonment police station during an encounter in 2013.

According to police, Karan is believed to be one of the most dangerous criminals in the district, who formed several gangs to commit robberies in Bareilly and adjacent districts.

Karan was arrested in an operation led by inspector Dharmendra Singh after receiving a tip-off. Police seized a country-made pistol from his possession.

Confirming the arrest, Bareilly SSP Shailesh Pandey told TOI, “The accused is undergoing treatment at the mission hospital where his condition is critical. Karan is one of the most dangerous criminals in the district.”

Title: SCR cautions against job racketeers
Content:
Aurangabad: The South Central Railway (SCR) has cautioned aspirants against job racketeers and touts as the SCR has been conducting recruitment to fill up vacancies.

The advisory comes after some people made false promises to youths aspiring to work in Indian Railways.

“The SCR has been undertaking the recruitment to fill up vacancies as per the need. In this connection, it is reiterated that railway administration takes up the process of recruitment of staff in a systematic manner through railway recruitment boards (RRB) and zonal railway recruitment cells (RRC) only,” as per the official release said.

“Candidates, who qualify in the written examination, are intimated through individual call-letters fixing the date for verification of records, medical test or viva,” SCR authorities said.

The employment notifications are sent in advance. SCR officials said the written examination are conducted under the strict supervision of officials.

“Youth should be aware of job racketeers and touts. Continuous efforts are being made by the vigilance and security organization of SCR to keep a tab on such activities through constant watch and raids against suspicious persons,” chief public relations officer of SCR, Ch Rakesh said.

Title: One drowns, 7 missing as boat capsizes in Gopalganj
Content:
PATNA: A woman drowned and eight others went missing when a country boat ferrying over 12 people capsized in the Gandak river in Gopalganj district on Saturday.

The body of a woman, Usha Devi (30) was fished out by the locals from the river. Four people swam to safety while eight others, including three women, were yet to be traced.

The incident took place around 9am when residents of Kotwa and Rajokhar Nawada villages under the Jadhopur police station area were crossing the Gandak river to reach Hirapakar diara.

The boatman lost balance due to overloading and the boat capsized in the river before it reached Mehandia ghat.

On getting information, Gopalganj sub-divisional officer Upendra Kumar Pal reached the spot and launched rescue operation. He confirmed the death of Usha, a resident of Kotwa in Gopalganj district.

“Prima facie it appears to be a case of overloading. The boat was ferrying more people than its capacity,” Pal said, adding local divers have been pressed into service to recover the bodies.

Those missing were identified as Hiralal (35), Anjali Kumari (25), Ajit Kumar (24), Rohit Kumar (35), his wife Nirmala Devi (30), Rajkali Devi (40) and her son Sachin (23).

However, Pintu Lal, Prabhnath Prasad, Sunil Kumar and Vimlawati Devi swam to safety. Majority of the victims were daily workers who were crossing the river to collect fodder for cattle.

Title: History-sheeters among three caught with marijuana in jail
Content:
Vadodara: Three prisoners, including two history-sheeters, were booked under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act and Prisons Act after one of them was caught with marijuana in his possession inside the jail premises on Friday afternoon.

Jail officials found two small packets containing marijuana from the shoes of an undertrial identified as Raja alias Rajesh Damor when he was frisked at the jail’s entry gate. Damor was being frisked in accordance with jail rules as he had return from the district court premises after attending a hearing of his case.

When Damor was questioned about the source of packets, he revealed that two history-sheeters – Samir alias Bunty Pandya and his brother Chirag Pandya – had given him the packets at the court asking him to hide them in his shoes and also told him that they will smoke together once the duo returns to the jail. Jail officials informed Raopura police station and the FSL about it. Forensic experts later confirmed that the contents of the packets was marijuana and weighed around 33.8 grams.

None of the accused have been arrested yet. Police said that after questioning Pandya brothers, they will be able to know how the duo managed to get the contraband amid police bandobast at the court.

It is not the first time that a jail inmates have been able to get marijuana during their visit to the court. In October 2018, a relative of an undertrial was arrested near Malhar Point on Old Padra Road while trying to pass a packet of marijuana to him when he was being taken back to jail from the court.

Title: Quota for PwDs in jobs: Court summons IGP on March 23
Content:
Representative image

JAIPUR: The court of the commissioner for specially abled persons has summoned the Iinspector general of police (recruitment) on March 23 and directed the department to clarify its position for not providing reservation to persons with disabilities (PwDs) in police constable recruitment .

The IGP (recruitment) has also been asked to submit relevant documents depending on which it seeks immunity.

In another order, the court has sought a report from the managing director of Rajasthan Skill and Livelihoods Development Corporation (RSLDC) on the action taken on skill development of PwDs and providing 5% reservation to them in recruitment in private commercial units.

Meanwhile, the IGP has been asked to be present in the court at 4.30pm on March 23. Earlier, IGP (recruitment) had claimed that one must be in a good mental and physical health and free from any mental or physical defect to be recruited as a constable in Rajasthan Police. He said this in a written reply to the commissioner for specially abled persons over reservation to persons with disabilities in police constable recruitment.

In its reply to the commissioner, IGP (recruitment) had stated, “A candidate for direct recruitment of the service, must be in good mental and bodily health and free from any mental or physical defect which is likely to interfere with the efficient performance of his duties as a member of the service and if selected, must produce a certificate to that effect from a medical authority notified by the government for the purpose.”

Earlier, disability commissioner Akhil Arora had directed the IGP (recruitment) to depose before the panel in order to give an explanation as to why they were not able to give reservation to persons with disabilities in police constable recruitment. IGP (recruitment), instead of deposing before the commission’s panel as directed, sent a reply to the commission.

Hemant Bhai Goyal, national vice-president, Divyang Adhikar Mahasangh, informed the commissioner that in Delhi, reservation is given to persons with disabilities in recruitment of police constables. “Their job is civil in nature and they don’t wear Delhi Police uniform,” he said.

IGP (recruitment), in its first letter to the commission, had stated there was no provision for giving reservation to specially abled persons in police constable recruitment, as per the Police Subordinate Service Rules, 1989.

Title: Two traders robbed of Rs 1.9 lakh in Budaun
Content:
Bareilly: Two traders were robbed of Rs 1.9 lakh by three miscreants in Dataganj area of Budaun district on Saturday morning.

Police said the traders — Shreeom Sharma and Mahesh Gupta — were on their way to a market in Samrer village from Daraganj on a motorbike. “They were carrying Rs 1.9 lakh cash in a bag with them. When they reached a deserted stretch near Bhatoli village, three people astride a bike stopped the duo and snatched the bag at gunpoint,” said police.

Station house officer of Dataganj police station Sanjay Singh said, “An FIR has been registered against the accused. We are investigating the matter and the accused will be arrested soon.”

Title: Min charges DMK with bid to create unrest in state
Content:
Madurai: Minister for milk products and dairy development, K T Rajenthra Bhalaji, on Saturday, said that the DMK was instigating people to indulge in violence and other unlawful activities because it was not able to bear the phenomenal growth of the AIADMK.

Speaking at a public meeting organized to commemorate the 72nd birth anniversary of the late chief minister J Jayalalithaa, near Watrap in Virudhunagar district, he said AIADMK had the full support of the people because of the extraordinary schemes implemented by the late chief minister during her rule. The DMK was trying to instigate violence and unrest in the state, but Tamil Nadu was AIADMK’s fortress and it would never allow this to happen in the state, Bhalaji said.

He said that at least one person from every family in the state would have benefitted from the numerous welfare schemes implemented by Jayalalithaa. Now, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami was following the footsteps of Jayalalithaa and performing outstandingly, he said. Because of the scheme to distribute Rs 1,000 as the pongal gift, the ration card holders would ensure that the AIADMK would sweep any election that will come in future, he added.

The members of the AIADMK always sought votes from the people only after bringing many schemes and nobody voted for money. The recently elected local body representatives had already done many developmental activities in their areas. Now, the chief minister was to lay the foundation stone for a medical college in Virudhunagar for the benefit of the people of this region, he said.

Title: 4 more held for HR executive’s murder
Content:
Vadodara: Four persons were nabbed on Friday for murdering a human resources executive in a case of road rage near Kaladarshan crossroads on Waghodiya Road last week.

Earlier their accomplice Suraj Kahar was arrested. Police said based on a tip-off, Dharmik alias Bhaylu Lohana, Parth alias Sonu Brahmbhatt, Ravi Machhi and Karansinh Rana were arrested from Ajwa Road. The five friends were passing by Kaladarshan crossroads on February 23 in their car, when victim Keval Jadav overtook them on his bike. Enraged by Jadav’s riding, they stopped him and beat him up. While Jadav did not suffer any external injuries, he complained of chest pain on reaching Panigate police station. Jadav was taken to Jamnabai Hospital and later referred to SSG Hospital as his condition became critical. However, on reaching SSG Hospital, doctors declared him dead before admission.

Jadav’s mother had registered a complaint of murder and rioting against unidentified persons. Police tracked down all five of them based on the car’s registration number. Jadav had mentioned the car’s registration number to police. tnn

Title: Citizen feedback ranks Bhopal fifth in ease of living survey
Content:
Murial Arts at Smart Road

BHOPAL: A citizen perception survey has found that Bhopal is among the top five cities in India to live.

Union ministry of urban development’s ease of living index assessment, an exercise to directly capture perception of citizens with respect to quality of life in their cities, concluded on Saturday.

According to Bhopal Smart City Development Corporation Limited (BSCDCL) as many as 1,11,234 responses were received from the Madhya Pradesh ’s capital as part of the survey.

The assessment was open to public from January 16 and ended on Saturday.

Bhopal got 28,474 less votes than Salem (Tamil Nadu), which bagged the first rank.

“It an important assessment exercise as it will help in directly capturing perception of citizens with respect to quality of life. We expect Bhopal to do much better when the other aspects of direct evaluation take place in the coming weeks,” said BSCDCL CEO, Deepak Singh.

In the next phase, a direct assessment by third party on the lines of the Swachh Survey will be undertaken.

It will identify living standards, which cities are identified under the smart cities’ mission, capital cities and a few more cities with a population of over a million.

In the first ease of living index released in 2018, Indore and Bhopal were ranked among the top 10 liveable cities in India.

Bhopal was placed at the 10th place, among 111 cities surveyed.

The index aims to assess the ease of living of citizens residing in the cities across three pillars -- quality of life, economic ability and sustainability. Furthermore, there are 14 categories (Education, Health , Housing and Shelter, WASH and SWM, Mobility, Safety and Security, Recreation, Economic Development, Economic Opportunities, Environment, Green spaces and building, Energy Consumption and City Resilience) and 50 other indicators.

An important aspect of this assessment is emphasis on collecting quality and reliable urban data through rigorous document check and physical audit. This would imbibe a culture of data-driven governance in cities to effectively plan, implement and monitor city services in the future, he added.

Title: Top 10 U-19 winners of Khel Mahakumbh felicitated
Content:
Dehradun: The top 10 winners of Under-19 boys and Under-19 girls 100-meter race in the Khel Mahakumbh , were felicitated by cabinet minister Arvind Pandey at the Pavilion Ground on Saturday.

The athlete who secured the first spot among both boys’ and girls’ events was awarded a car, while the rest of the winners were given two-wheelers (scooty).

The race had taken place several days back at the Maharana Pratap Sports College in Raipur.

The top 10 winners of U-19 boys 100-metre race are: Mohit Purohit (Dehradun), Akashdeep Singh (Champawat), Gopal Thakur (US Nagar), Deepanshu Kumar (US Nagar), Rakesh Roshan (Dehradun), Vishal Kumar (Haridwar), Ajay Gautam (US Nagar), Rohan Singh (US Nagar), Sunny Yadav (US Nagar) and Suraj Singh (Pithoragarh).

The top 10 winners of U-19 girls 100-metre race are: Tanisha Bhatt (Dehradun), Nikita (Tehri), Ritika (Rudraprayag), Jaskiran Kaur (US Nagar), Utkarsha Pandey (Nainital), Sandhya Negi (Bageshwar), Shalini (Chamoli), Kajal (Pauri Garhwal), Gauri (Rudraprayag) and Priyanka (Pauri Garhwal).

Title: Muzaffarnagar bids adieu to slain IB official Ankit Sharma
Content:
MUZAFFARNAGAR: Hundreds of residents on Saturday paid their last respects to slain Intelligence Bureau official Ankit Sharma who was killed in the Delhi riots . The urn with his ashes was brought to Shiv Chowk, the main crossing in city, before it was taken to Haridwar for immersion in the Ganga.

Ankit Sharma, a native of Itawa village of Muzaffarnagar, was cremated on Thursday with full state honours.

Condemning the killing of innocent people in the riots, city MLA from Muzaffarnagar Kapil Dev Agarwal, who is a state minister (independent charge), termed Ankit’s murder a “result of a conspiracy”.

Accusing Aam Aadmi Party leader Tahir Hussain for the killing, Agarwal told reporters, “Petrol bombs, stones and illegal weapons were recovered from Hussain’s house, which is proof of a conspiracy to foment violence in Delhi.”

Ankit’s relatives and friends from Delhi, Union minister Sanjeev Balyan, the DM and the SSP of Muzaffarnagar were among the hundreds of people who bid him a final adieu.

Earlier on Friday, Ankkit’s father, Ravinder Sharma, had appealed to the AAP-led Delhi government to provide a government job to a member of his family and accord a “martyr” status to his son. He told TOI, “We have not received any relief from the government so far. The Arvind Kejriwal government should give a government job to a member of my family now, and also martyr status to Ankit.”

Title: Experts: Use of native plant species crucial
Content:
Hyderabad: Use of natural flowers and native species of plants in the city is crucial to the environment, said experts on Saturday, while speaking at the 14th International Landscape and Gardening Expo.

There has been a decline in the use of natural flowers with consumers buying more plastic-based variants, said S Jafar Naqvi, president, Indian Flowers and Ornamental Plants Association (iFlora). The theme of the expo was ‘Go for Fresh, Ban Artificial and Plastic Flowers’.

“Large amounts of artificial flowers are being imported which has led to a huge decline in the demand for fresh flowers by bulk consumers in India,” said Naqvi.

Naturalist Asiya Khan said, “Landscapers and architects are primary influencers. They must learn to market native species over exotic ones,” she said.S P Anchuri, conservation architect, said, “While designing buildings, it is necessary to create adequate green zones.”

NVS Reddy, MD, HMRL, said, “Plantation on roadsides where the Metro rail project has come up is a priority.”

Giving a historical perspective, INTACH Hyderabad convenor Anuradha Reddy said, “Flowers have been used for centuries. One can see trees and plants depicted in miniature paintings.”

Title: Kota serial rapist and killer given capital punishment
Content:
Representative image

JAIPUR: A trial court in Kota awarded capital punishment to a 50-year-old man on Friday for the murder of a 40-year-old woman in Vigyan Nagar police station area of Kota.

The court also slapped a penalty of Rs 5,000 on the convict. The case was taken up by the Kota police under the “case officer scheme” and the police officials not only used DNA tests but other scientific evidence to get conviction in the case in nine months after filing the chargesheet.

“The case was taken up in ‘case officer scheme’ and the witnesses were taken to the court on regular basis for statements,” Munindra Singh, SHO of Vigyan Nagar, Kota, said.

The “case officer scheme” is an innovation of the Rajasthan police where popular or notorious cases are earmarked for an integrated effort of the police, the prosecution agency, and the judiciary to ensure a speedy trial.

The case was registered in 2019 after a mutilated and decomposed body of a 40-year-old woman was found in the backyard of a school.

“The woman went missing on May 22, 2019, and two days after she went missing, her body was recovered, but it was not possible to identify it. The assailant had slashed open her abdomen and stuffed all her clothes in it. We found that the cloths belonged to a woman who is from the Bhat community. We called in members of the Bhat community and took DNA samples from a 22-year-old girl whose mother had gone missing. The samples of the victim and the girl matched, and we could identify the victim,” Amrita Duhan, ASP of Kota city, told TOI over phone.

Police then recovered CCTV footages of area and nearby areas where the body was found. “We arrested the accused, one Mohan Lal, 50, almost 20 days after the murder. We found that he fled from Sanganer jail four years ago. He was convicted in a similar case of rape and murder of a woman and was serving life term at Sanganer open jail. Lal confessed that he killed the woman when she resisted his attempt to rape her,” Amrita said.

On Friday, the presiding officer Kailash Chandra Mishra of POCSO court, Kota, awarded capital punishment to the convict.

POCSO courts, established under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, 2012, also try cases related to heinous crimes against adults, when the pressure of their regular cases is low.

“We argued that this is a heinous crime and brought to the notice of the court that the arrested accused is a serial rapist and killer . We demanded capital punishment for him,” Suresh Verma, public prosecutor in the case, said.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: P&T Colony fire was the fallout of a one-sided love affair, say cops
Content:
Bhopal: Seven days after the massive fire in the parking lot of a four-storeyed building at P&T Colony in Kamla Nagar in which eight two-wheelers, including bikes, scooters and a kid's bicycle parked under the building, were completely gutted, police on Saturday revealed that the offence was committed by a jilted lover and his friend. The object of his affection resided in the building, and his friend. The accused torched the girl’s scooter and the fire spread in all the vehicles parked under the building.

ASP (Crime branch) Nishchal Jharia said that during investigations, police found a video which provided major clues. The supects, who committed the crime, were identified as Sumit Jatav and Harsh Mehra. The same accused had torched three two-wheelers, including two scooters and a bike at Shivaji Nagar in MP Nagar police station area, just five hours before committing the Kamla Nagar crime. A case was registered against the accused at MP Nagar police station.

ASP Jharia said that the prime accused Jatav, a resident of Ambedkar Nagar, had a one-sided love affair with a girl, who resides in the apartment in Kamla Nagar where the fire took place. He had barged into the girl's flat and assaulted her in the past. She had filed a complaint against him with Kamla Nagar police after which he was arrested.

ASP Jharia said that Jatav wanted to take revenge and torched her scooter, after which the fire spread to other vehicles. Police using technical evidence have found Jatav's involvement in the crime but he is on the run. A search was on to nab him.

Minister PC Sharma and the local corporator had visited the P&T Colony on getting information about the incident.

Title: ‘State govt to give more jobs to ex-servicemen, kin’
Content: Dehradun: On the Raising Day of Uttarakhand Purva Sainik Kalyan Nigam (UPSKN), CM Trivendra Singh Rawat said on Saturday that the state government would open more job avenues for the dependents of ex-servicemen in various departments this year.

Title: Triple drug therapy campaign aims to eliminate filariasis, says Tope
Content:
Nagpur: The government of Maharashtra formally launched the Mass Drug Administration (MDA) campaign in six districts of the state from Nagpur on March 2. The campaign aims to eliminate Lymphatic Filariasis from the state. Apart from Nagpur, it will cover Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Bhandara, Gondia and Nanded districts.

Maharashtra minister for public health and family welfare Rajesh Tope formally launched this campaign through video conferencing.

During the launch ceremony, the health minister highlighted that Maharashtra is a high-burden state with 18 districts being endemic to Lymphatic Filariasis.

“Government has deep concern for elimination of this Filariasis. Health department officials should take this campaign as a war against this deadly disease which causes the affected families to live their lives in misery,” he said.

Tope also urged principals of private schools to contribute in making this campaign successful as this disease gets transmitted early in childhood that usually goes unnoticed. He highlighted that most people do not take these drugs due to lack of knowledge about the benefits.

“If some people consume the drugs while others don’t, then the whole community is at risk of filaria. All members of the community need to ensure that they take these drugs under the supervision of health workers and motivate others to do the same. It is the responsibility of each one of us to make MDA a success,” he said.

During the MDA rounds, drug administrators will provide free-of-cost drugs to all eligible beneficiaries of the endemic districts through door-to-door campaign and through booth approach followed by mop-up rounds to cover left out areas. The consumption will be directly observed (DOT) by the drug administrators like it is done under the TB program with exception of children below 2 years, pregnant women and people suffering from serious diseases.

Benefits of anti-filaria drugs administered during Mass Drug Administration rounds

The consumption of MDA drugs during MDA round will curtail transmission of micro-filaria parasites circulating in the community. There are also other benefits like treating parasitic infections caused by intestinal worms. This improves nutrition uptake and helps physical and cognitive development of the children. Additional benefits of consuming anti-filaria drugs include curing other infection like scabies and lice.

Status of Filaria in Maharashtra

As of 2019, Maharashtra has recorded 18 districts as endemic. These include Akola, Amravati, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Jalgaanv, Latur, Nagpur, Nanded, Nandurbar, Osmanabad, Sindhudurg, Solapur, Thane — Palghar, Vardha and Yavatmal. Until 2018-19 34,064 lymphoedema cases and 16,429 hydrocele cases have been recorded.

Title: Baglamukhi priest booked again for cheating
Content:
Dr Prashant Upadhyay

Vadodara: Another offence of cheating was registered against Dr Prashant Upadhyay, the priest of Shri Baglamukhi Brahmastra Vidya Mandir, by one of his followers at Gotri police station on Friday.

The complainant Prekhsa Vyas has alleged that Upadhyay took around Rs 10.4 lakh from her and her husband Kinjal Vyas for different reasons and promised to settle their marital discord. Vyas said that initially Upadhyay created animosity between the couple.

Upadhyay used to talk to Preksha and Kinjal on separate phone calls and also record those calls. Police said that he then used to make each other listen to those call recordings to create rift between them.

When the quarrels increased, Preksha and Kinjal decided to divorce each other. Upadhyay then intervened and promised to bring normalcy between the couple.

The priest then ask money from them for different reasons.
