Speaking to TOI, Rathore confirmed that BSF will help in rebuilding the house and giving compensation to the jawan’s family. “BSF is always there for our men and their families. We came here to show our support to Anees’ family,” said Rathore.

“As soon as we got to know about the ordeal of the BSF jawan and his family, we contacted the father and sent our men here. We will provide compensation to Anees’ family and our engineering team is already assessing the damage,” said the DIG, who also inspected the entire building.

The 29-year-old jawan is scheduled to marry in a few months. “We should be able to help him bring back his house in good shape before that,” Rathore added.

Addressing the huge crowd that had gathered at Anees’ house, Rathore said: “Several riots have happened in the country, but people start to live together in harmony even after that. I hope that happens here too.”

Recounting how his house was lost in just three hours, Mohammad Munees, the jawan’s father, said: “The whole thing started in the morning and went on for three hours. The mob first burnt a car near our house and then started hurling petrol bombs. I tried calling the police but they arrived very late. After I was escorted out, the mob entered the house and burnt everything. They also stole several items.”

However, despite all the loss, Munees has a message of peace to share. “I want to give the message of brotherhood to all those who live in the area. We have been living here for over 30 years and I wish people stay together in harmony in future too,” he said.

Title: Delhi: Two Nirbhaya convicts file pleas, Tihar told to reply
Content:
Akshay Thakur (L); Pawan Gupta (R)

NEW DELHI: As the date of hanging approaches, convicts in the Nirbhaya case have once again got active.

Saturday saw two of the four moving a Delhi court seeking a stay on the execution of the death warrants, scheduled for March 3, on the ground that a fresh mercy plea had been filed by Akshay Thakur .

Additional Session Judge Dharmender Rana issued notice to Tihar Jail authorities on the pleas moved of Thakur and Pawan Gupta , directing the officials to file their response by March 2.

In his plea moved through his lawyer, Thakur claimed he had filed a fresh mercy petition before the President, which was pending and therefore the death warrants needed to be deferred.

Meanwhile, advocate A P Singh, appearing for Mukesh Singh, claimed that his earlier mercy petition dismissed by the President did not have complete facts and were filed in a hurry which led to it being incomplete.

Gupta, in his plea, told the court he had filed a curative petition before the Supreme Court, which too was pending. He said that he also had the option of filing a mercy petition, which he was yet to exercise.

On February 17, the court had ordered that the four convicts — Singh, Gupta, Thakur and Vinay Sharma be hanged on March 3 after it issued fresh death warrants, observing that deferring the execution any further would be “sacrilegious” to the rights of the victim for expeditious justice.

It directed that the four men be hanged by neck on March 3 at 6am. This was for the third time that the death warrants were issued by the court against them.

The court had noted that death warrants were earlier issued on January 7 and the execution was later deferred twice, i.e., on January 17 and January 31.

Except Gupta the other three had exhausted their mercy plea.

The first date of execution, January 22, was postponed to February 1 by a January 17 court order. Then the trial court, on January 31, stayed “till further orders” the execution of the four convicts as they had not exhausted all their legal remedies.

Meanwhile, in a connected development a PIL was filed on Saturday in Delhi high court seeking directions to the National Human Rights Commission to set up an inquiry and submit a report about the physical and mental condition of the four death row convicts.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Lourenco: Heed SC’s views, save green cover
Content:
Panaji: Chief minister Pramod Sawant needs to act on the Supreme Court’s observation regarding preservation of the state’s green cover , Curtorim MLA Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco said.

“I would like to bring to the attention of the chief minister that green cover in almost all village panchayats and municipal areas is being systematically destroyed by the powerful builders’ lobby, who are mostly non-Goans and possess just one motto, to mint money by corrupting officials,” Lourenco said adding that district collectors, deputy collectors and other government officials have failed to stop this ecological destruction. “Corrective action must be taken to prevent constant chopping down of trees across the state,” he said.

Lourenco cited recent Supreme Court proceedings where a three-member bench presided by Chief Justice S A Bobde had asked central government authorities to look at ways to create roads without cutting trees.

He did, however, thank Sawant for withdrawing Section 144 and the circular notifying 56 villages as urban areas.

Title: Ahmedabad woman ‘hypnotized’ by eunuchs, loses Rs 1 lakh
Content: AHMEDABAD: Two imposters posing as eunuchs stole a gold chain, a gold ring and cash all worth Rs 1 lakh from a flat in Regency Tower in Vastrapur area on Friday morning. The complainant, Kundanben Patel, 54, said that the eunuchs had come to her house to take donation for Holi festival. According to Patel, the entered the house and hypnotized her. She doesn’t know when the two went away from the house.Assistant commissioner of police, A division, Mukesh Patel, said they have registered an offence under sections 400, 420, 380 and 114 of the IPC against the duo. “We have identified them. They have committed such offences several times in the past. We have the registration number of the car in which they had come. We will nab them soon,” said Patel.According to the complaint, Patel and his son Harsh, 27, live in the flat. On Friday morning, two persons dressed as eunuchs rang the doorbell. “Patel went to the grill fixed on the door and saw that two eunuchs were having water at their neighbour’s house. They asked Patel to give them Holi donation. Patel then went inside the house to ask her son how much donation to give. Harsh said give them Rs 200. When Patel came out, one of the importers asked Patel how many persons are living in their house, to which Patel replied she and her son,” said a senior police official.Soon, another imposter asked for water. “Patel went inside the kitchen to fetch water. When she came out both the imposters were sitting on the sofa in the main hall. She only remembers standing before them. About half an hour later when her son came out, he asked Patel about her gold chain, diamond-studded ring which were missing. Even Rs 10,000 was missing from the cupboard. Patel, who was then sitting on the swing, was not even aware when the two went away from the house,” added a police source.When Patel and her son Harsh asked the watchman, Jodbhai Shukla, he said that the eunuchs had come in a car and then left in the same car.“The registration number of the car is partially caught on the CCTV camera,” added a police official.

Title: Ahmedabad: Honey-trapped with dating lure, man duped of Rs 4.5 lakh
Content:
Representative Image

AHMEDABAD: A 26-year-old youth, a resident of Vastrapur originally from Kolkata, who is a consultant with a private company, fell into a trap set by cyber cheats, who lured him with the promise of chatting with a woman on a dating application.

The cheats took Rs 4,59,415 from him before he realized he had been cheated. They had threatened to upload his identity card on social media and defame him.

The youth first approached the cyber cell on February 2, and finally lodged an FIR at Vastrapur police station. ACP A Division Mukesh Patel said they have lodged an offence for cheating under Sections 406, 420, 506(1) and 114 of the IPC.

“We have the phone numbers the cheats used to call the victim to demand money.We will track these numbers and the bank account in which they made the victim pay the money,” he added.

According to the FIR lodged by the victim, in December 2019, he thought of chatting with a woman online. “Through a search engine, he got a number and a photo of a woman on a dating website. He called the number, but the person on the other end, she was not the one he has called,” said a Vastrapur police official.

He received a missed call from the same number at about noon when he was at work. He called back at about 2pm. The person on the other end identified herself as Dimpy and said that she ran a dating agency.

According to FIR, she asked the victim his location to arrange a meeting with a girl. She said he would have to become a member of the club first, by paying Rs 1,000. The victim paid the money into a bank account specified by the woman.

The woman then called him again and asked for his identity card and email address and how old he wanted the woman to be. He then provided his identity card to the woman.

The woman sent him two pictures of women on WhatsApp, and he picked a 26-year-old woman and deposited Rs 22,400. The cheats later made the victim pay a total of Rs 4,59,415 on various pretexts before he realized he had been cheated.

When he asked for his money back, the cheats threatened saying they would upload his picture on social media and defame him, said a police official.

Title: 8-mth-old girl abducted from Elliot’s rescued
Content:
Chennai: Scanning footage from as many as 150 CCTV cameras from Besant Nagar to Jafferkhanpet, police on Saturday rescued an eight-month-old girl, less than 36 hours after she was kidnapped from her mother’s side on the Elliot’s beach, and arrested five people including a juvenile. While K Manikandan, 26, of Jafferkhanpet, A Thirupathi Ammal, 42, of Saidapet, and S Mary, 35, and her son S Ruben, 19, of Saidapet were sent to jail, the minor, daughter of Thirupathiammal, was admitted to the correctional facility in Kelly’s.

Police said Manikandan’s elder sister Pandi Meena, who worked as a maid, didn’t have children and was desperate for one. Through a common friend she came to know of Thirupathiammal, who allegedly made a living as a surrogate mother, and Mary. Pandi Meena then told Manikandan, 26, who offered the two women Rs 2 lakh for a child, an officer said.

After trying to get some narikurava women in Besant Nagar to sell a baby, Mary and Thirupathiammal decided to steal one when the women refused, he added.

On Thursday night, Mary, Ruben, Thirupathiammal and her daughter went to the Elliot’s beach. Around 2am on Friday, they went to the skating rink. One woman sat close to Rajeshwari and her mother Sneha, narikuravas from Kumbakonam. Around 4am, Selvi woke up and found her daughter missing. She rushed to the nearest police station with her niece. A case was registered but police found no CCTV camera at the spot. About 100 metres away, a camera caught four people including two women boarding an autorickshaw.

Police questioned an auto driver who confirmed the four had boarded his vehicle and that one woman carried a child. Police checked footage from CCTV cameras at Chinnamalai near Saidapet and at Jafferkhanpet. One showed the gang handing over the child to Manikandan, a second showed him walking home with the girl and a third had him handing her over to Pandi Meena.

On Saturday afternoon, a police team landed at Manikandan’s house and later rescued the girl from Pandi Meena’s house. She was reunited with her parents in the evening.

Adyar assistant commissioner Vinoth Shantharam who formed the special team and its members sub-inspectors Jai Ganesh and Karthikeyan and constables Thirumurugan, Pushparaj, Damodharan, Senthilkumar, Venkateshwaran and Vinod won praise from commissioner A K Viswanathan.

Title: Revanth blames TRS for 2BHK delay
Content:
Hyderabad: Telangana Congress working president A Revanth Reddy on Saturday said the state government has got Rs 9,000 crore, including central funding and loans from Hudco for 2BHK project. “Despite receiving such a huge amount, the 2BHK project is incomplete because TRS government has not paid bills to contractors constructing these houses,” said Revanth during his Patnam Ghosha programme in Malkajgiri.

He said that municipal administration minister KT Rama Rao should visit the 2BHK project sites and explain reasons for the delay. TNN

Title: Power tariff hike may be delayed
Content:
Hyderabad: The Telangana Southern and Northern Power Distribution Companies (Discoms) have deferred submission of aggregate revenue requirement (ARR) to Telangana State Electricity Regulatory Commission (TSERC). They were supposed to submit the ARR, seeking power tariff hike, to TSERC on Saturday. Now, they are likely to submit it after the budget session of the Assembly. Sources said that any tariff hike proposals submitted to TSERC would provide ammunition to the opposition Congress and BJP during the budget session of the Assembly. So, the submission of ARR has been deferred.

As per rules, TSERC conducts public hearings on the proposed tariff hike after Discoms submit ARR to it. After this, TSERC takes a call on the hike. This exercise takes a minimum of one month. tnn

Title: Delhi: They wait for missing at mortuary
Content:
A relative holds missing Aftab’s photo outside the mortuary

NEW DELHI: Rizwan Khan has been at GTB Hospital mortuary for three days, clutching his brother’s photograph, waiting for some news about him. His brother Aftab, a Class XI student, had come to Delhi to make some money. From what Rizwan gathered, Aftab and his two friends encountered a mob in Shiv Vihar on February 25. While the others managed to hide in a nearby godown, Aftab took the blows, a contractor who brought him to Delhi told Khan. The contractor too had a close shave and escaped only by chanting ‘Jai Mata Di’.

The godown was set on fire by the rioters, but the police came in within 45 minutes and rescued the two boys from the back entrance. There was no news of Aftab in GTB Hospital or Urban Hospital , Khan doesn’t know if he is in jail, whether he is alive or dead. He doesn’t dare go to Shiv Vihar to file an FIR, because he has heard the situation is “still dangerous for Muslims”.

Just on Friday, ragpicker Ayub was lynched in the area when he ventured out in desperate need of food, Khan pointed out. “My brother is gentle and helpful, he once dreamed of being a doctor,” he said. He hoped that someone would bring him news, while his mother stood distraught next to him. “I pray a lot, dekhte hain dua mein kitna asar hai,” he said.

As he spoke, two other bodies were brought out from the hospital. Aamir and Hashim were brothers whose bodies were found in a drain in Ganga Vihar, Gokulpuri. Aamir was a cab driver, his brother a tailor, said a person standing by the family.

Not heeding the warning of their eldest brother Shairuddin, 25-year-old Aamir and 19-year-old Hashim set out from Ghaziabad on Wednesday evening to meet their family in the violence-hit Gokulpuri. The following day, after they went missing, their family rushed to GTB Hospital and identified the bodies.

According to Akram, a family friend, “Around 8.45pm Shairuddin received a call from Aamir that he was coming to Gokulpuri to meet him and warned him not to.”

All this while, a family waited for the hospital to hand them the body of their son. “It has been four days. We have come here from Madhubani, Bihar. Police are not cooperating. Our tears have dried up; we just want to take the body and go home,” said Mohammad Ibrahim, father of 35-year-old Mubarak Hussain, who died during the violence.

Several community elders from Dilshad Garden are assenting in the processes at the hospital. S Hasan, a former RWA head and retired government official, suggested that the hospital set up a nodal point for those seeking news. “This is was a big problem earlier, because the police officer had not been coming regularly, which delayed the postmortems, but now, with the intervention from Shahdara and Seemapuri MLAs, the permission process has been simplified,” he said.

Most of those who died were migrant labourers, the poorest, he said. Among the dead was a hotel worker from Uttarakhand, Dalbir Singh. His brother could not even afford a cremation, but Hasan, Mohammed Daoud and others bore the cost of the ambulance and the last rites.

Meanwhile, Jhilmil Colony gurdwara has set up a free tea, water and snacks stand for everyone at the hospital. People from Dilshad Garden bring food for the families too.

In a shed, where families, lawyers and journalists were milling around, one man accompanied a neighbour, whose son, 22-year-old Salman, was shot in the head. Displaying his photo, he said, “He lived in Loni and worked in a small shop in Mustafabad. His father is inside waiting for the postmortem to be completed.” Hearing the conversation, a policeman nearby responded, “Insaniyat khatam ho gayi, people are worse than animals.

Title: Chennai: Rajasthan duo held for conning people, posing to be army men
Content:
The accused duo

CHENNAI: The cyber-crime wing police arrested two people from Rajasthan who conned people by uploading photos of ‘army vehicles for sale’ in an online portal, pretending to be army officials.

At least 20 people lodged police complaints about the post on the online portal after they paid money believing the post to be genuine. The victims had wanted to buy used army vehicles at cheaper rates.

The accused identified as M Naresh Pal Singh, 36, and L Bachchu Singh, 26, were arrested from their hometown by a team of the cybercrime wing. Police said the duo is part of a gang that has cheated people across the country to the tune of more than Rs100 crore.

Narrating the modus operandi, a cyber-crime wing official said the duo had posted photos of two-wheelers, cars and trucks on the popular e-commerce platform OLX, claiming to be army personnel who wanted to sell the vehicles as they had transferred to another town. The gang shared fake documents of the vehicle to make it seem a genuine deal and enticed people by quoting a cheap price.

“They demanded Rs5,000 to Rs50,000 as advance, depending upon the nature of the vehicles and were asked the money to be transferred through e-payment portals. After the money was transferred, they would keep giving excuses for the delay and eventually snap ties with the buyer,” said an officer.

After the CCB received several similar complaints, a team was formed. “The team went to Rajasthan and nabbed the duo after a lot of struggle as the local police were not helpful. We were not even allowed to enter their village initially,” said police. They were produced before a magistrate at Bharatpur and will be brought to Chennai on Sunday. Police suspect that a larger network is at work in Rajasthan and further investigation is on.

Title: Fin mins’ meet on March 13
Content:
Hyderabad: The 15th Finance Commission has convened a meeting of all state finance ministers in New Delhi on March 13 to seek their views on how the state fiscal responsibility and budget management (FRBMs) can be aligned with central FRBM legislation. The meeting would also discuss about the priority of state-specific grant proposals.

“We will welcome any additional inputs which can plan our approach to the complex issues related to fiscal federalism,” XV Finance Commission chairman NK Singh said in a letter inviting Telangana finance minister T Harish Rao to the meeting. tnn

Title: Modern Gandhians felicitated
Content:
Ahmedabad: They come from all walks of life, range from highly educated to primary school graduates, work in metros like Bengaluru but also the conflict zone of Bastar, and have varied fields of work ranging from rural economy to water conservation. What connects the 15 winners of the maiden ‘Gandhi Award’, which comes with a a citation and Rs 51,000 cash award, is their faith in the Gandhian way of transforming society.

Gujarat Vidyapith and the US-based Gandhian Society on Saturday organized an event at Vidyapith to felicitate thes 15 individuals from seven Indian states for their exemplary work at the grassroots level.

The awardees included Chandan Pal (Kolkata), Shilpa Vaishnav (Virampur), Nilam Patel (Khoba), Shailesh Singhal (New Delhi), Parul Dandikar (Vadodara), Jaldeep Thakar (Pedhamali), Jayesh Raval (Patadi), Bharati (Chhattisgarh), John Chelladurai (Jalgaon), Anand Malligavad (Bengaluru), Dipika Raval (Ahmedabad), Radhekrishna (Agra), Debasis Majmudar (Tripura), Suresh Punadiya (Zarda) and Bachu Dedun (Banaskantha).

The awards were conferred by Elaben Bhatt, chancellor, and Anamik Shah, vice-chancellor of Gujarat Vidyapith.

Title: BJP names brother of Cumbharjua MLA in its second ZP list
Content:
Panaji: Hours after Cumbharjua MLA Pandurang Madkaikar’s brother, Dhaku, was inducted into BJP , the party announced him as its St Lawrence candidate for the upcoming zilla panchayat (ZP) elections .

Dhaku, along with 12 other candidates — seven for North Goa and six for South Goa — formed part of BJP’s second ZP list. The other candidates announced were Kartik Kudnekar for Succorro; Rupesh Naik for Reis Magos; Radhika Sawant for Penha de Franca; Savanna Araujo for St Cruz; Anjali Naik for Taleigao; Girish Uskaikar for Chimbel; Sanjana Naik for Curti-Khandepar; Deepak Borkar for Borim; Narayan Kamat for Shiroda; Suvarna Tendulkar for Sanvordem; Sudha Gaonkar for Dharbandora and Sidharth Gauns Dessai for Xeldem. With this, BJP has announced candidates for 31 constituencies — 21 in the north and 10 in the south.

BJP state president Sadanand Shet Tanavade said 10 more names were to be announced, but it was deferred due to last minute consultations. “All names will be announced on or before March 4,” he said. When asked about former Tivim MLA Kiran Kandolkar’s demand of a ZP ticket for his wife, he said that in BJP, everyone had the right to demand a ticket.

Reacting to a possible Congress-MGP poll alliance, he said, “We will fight the polls based on the strength of our organisation.”

Title: Goa must look ‘with all seriousness’ Mauvin’s aide’s role in MPDA: HC
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: The high court of Bombay at Goa has asked the state government to look at the potential conflict of interest in the way Mormugao Planning and Development Authority ( MPDA ) took decisions and asked the BJP-led government to look at the role played by civic body member Kamla Prasad Yadav and panchayat minister Mauvin Godinho’s aide’s role “with all seriousness”.

Expressing concerns over potential conflict of interest in the way MPDA took decisions, the HC said that these decisions are “vulnerable” to be overturned “if challenged”.

The high court’s observations came while ordering actions against “unauthorised constructions mushrooming” around Goa International Airport and in light of the resolution passed by MPDA on November 18 rejecting the colour-coded zoning map (CCZM) prepared by the Navy as per the civil aviation ministry’s provisions.

Godinho, the Dabolim MLA, is also a member of the MPDA, while Yadav is a deputy sarpanch of Chicalim panchayat.

Godinho had accused the Navy of ruling Goa by proxy and regulating construction around the state’s lone airport. At the core of Godinho’s outrage are buildings with over 100 flats—survey numbers 60/2, 63/5 and 63/8— built by Yadav.

Though justices Mahesh Sonak and Mukulika Jawalkar chose not to go deeper into the issue, they did stress that it “disturbing” to see that Yadav is a member of MPDA and allegedly responsible for “unauthorised construction” around the airport.

“What is more disturbing is that one of the parties to these petitions Kamla Prasad Yadav (builder) who is alleged to have undertaken the unauthorised construction in prima facie defiance of 2015 Rules and the CCZM prepared thereunder, in his capacity as the deputy sarpanch and member of the MPDA, is also a party to the resolution,” the court said.

The high court said that “impression is created” that MPDA and the Chicalim panchayat are interested in protecting illegal structures “regardless of issue of aviation safety”.

The counsel for MPDA and the lawyer for Yadav informed the high court that the Town And Country Planning Act did not prevent members of planning authorities from taking part in decisions where there is personal interest.

Counsel for the petitioner, advocate Rohit Bras De Sa said that Yadav’s personal interest was served when MPDA passed the resolution. “This is a serious issue because you are not only playing with national security but also with people’s lives. The conflict of interest can be seen in the resolution where basically they were trying to defy the court,” De Sa said.

“According to us, at least prima facie, this is a case of conflict between interest and duty,” the high court said.

The high court also pulled up the state government for not doing enough to stop the illegalities around the airport.

“In a petition of this nature, our role is to basically activate statutory authorities who, despite acknowledging that unauthorised constructions, which pose danger to aviation safety, have come up around the airport, have failed to take any meaningful action against the same,” the high court said.

Title: Ahmedabad: Sons and wife tie up man, beat him
Content:
Representative Image

AHMEDABAD: Dinesh Parmar, 43, lodged a complaint at Amraiwadi police station on Friday alleging that his wife Sushila and three sons, Vijay, 23, and two minors, bound him with a dog chain and hit him with metal pipes. He is being treated at LG Hospital.

Inspector R T Udavat of Amraiwadi police station said they have arrested Sushila and Vijay under Sections 324, 323, 114, 294(b), 506 (2) of the IPC and under Section 135(1) of the Gujarat Police Act. Parmar often comes home drunk, local residents said.

According to Parmar’s complaint, on Friday, he went to a funeral in the morning and returned at around 11am. “His wife and children were at home. His wife then asked him where had he been roaming and why he did not go to work,” said a police official.

Parmar claims that his wife then started abusing him and got agitated. “According to Parmar, Vijay then hit him on the face with an iron pipe while his two minor sons got a dog chain, tied his hands behind his back and made him lie on a cot. They then started hitting him with iron pipes,” a police source said. Parmar stated that on hearing his cries, his neighbours rushed in and saved him.

Title: Farooq aides’ assets attached over JKCA scam
Content:
National Conference president Farooq Abdullah ( Picture credits: TOI)

NEW DELHI/SRINAGAR: In a further setback to former J&K chief minister Farooq Abdullah , the Enforcement Directorate on Saturday attached assets of Rs 2.6 crore of Ahsan Ahmad Mirza and Mir Manzoor Gazanffer, close associates of the former CM, in a money laundering case for alleged misappropriation of funds of the J&K Cricket Association.

The attached assets consist of three FDRs (fixed deposit receipts) of Rs 1.29 crore with J&K Bank branch in Lajpat Nagar, New Delhi. 11 Kanals of land with structure and commercial shopping complex at Pandrethan in Srinagar to the tune of Rs 1.31 crore ,” the ED in a statement said.

The ED has also unearthed several transactions where the JKCA funds were transferred “illegally” in the personal accounts of Mirza.

Sources said, between 2002 and 2011, the JKCA received Rs 112 crore from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Abdullah, then as its president, “appointed” Mirza as “treasurer” in 2003 though he was not elected at that time and through him allegedly laundered the money of the JKCA.

The ED, which has already questioned Abdullah once in the same case registered under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, has found that the former CM had allegedly used Mirza to open several accounts in the J&K Bank using fictitious documents to launder funds. Abdullah is currently under detention under the Public Safety Act .

Abdullah had allegedly made Mirza signatory to cheques issued in the name of J&K Cricket Association. Mirza, though not elected office bearer, was made “treasurer” of J&K Cricket Association by Abdullah through a resolution signed by him and then general secretary of the association, according to ED’s investigation.

The role of a senior executive of the J&K Bank, now retired, is also under scrutiny for helping the former J&K CM in opening these bank accounts based on “inadequate” documents. Mirza raised loans in these accounts from the bank and transferred them to his personal account and further laundered them, the probe has revealed.

When in 2007, the then elected treasurer of J&K Cricket Association (JKCA), Mir Manzoor Gazanffer, brought these fictitious transactions to the notice of JKCA president Farooq Abdullah, the latter ignored the anomalies in the association’s accounts, the ED probe has revealed. Gazanffer is now one of the accused for laundering the proceeds of crime.

It has been found that cheques of JKCA were deposited in the personal accounts of Mirza. Questioning of elected treasurer Gazanffer by the ED further revealed that he had signed some cheques, which were deposited in the personal accounts of Mirza, at the instructions of Farooq Abdullah.

Mirza was arrested by the ED in this case and a charge sheet under the PMLA has also been filed before a special court in Srinagar.

Title: Cheating complaint against shop owner
Content:
Ahmedabad: A 32-year-old resident of Maninagar, Jaswinder Chabra, who has an electricals shop on CG Road, lodged a complaint at Navrangpura police station on Friday accusing Vishal Gupta and his wife Hiral, residents of Motera, of cheating him of Rs 80,825 by not paying for fans they had taken from him.

According to the complaint, the Guptas also have an electricals shop in Navranpura and used to buy goods from him. “Earlier, they paid their dues regularly but from July 2019 to February 28, 2020, they took 57 fans from Chabra and gave him post-dated cheques,” said a Navrangpura police official.

The FIR states that the cheques bounced when Chabra deposited them. “When he demanded payment, the Guptas threatened him saying they could do whatever they wanted as they are well-connected. We registered a complaint under Sections 406, 420, 294(b) and 506(1) of the IPC,” said Navranpura police official.

Title: Delhi riots: 69 applicants to get relief today, but locals skip camps for relatives’ homes
Content:
A man sits with his child as he takes shelter at Al-Hind Hospital after he fled his home following clashes (Fi... Read More

NEW DELHI: A total of 69 riot-affected persons have applied till Saturday evening to take immediate monetary relief of Rs 25,000 announced by chief minister Arvind Kejriwal . After holding a marathon meeting to review the distribution of relief and implementation of rehabilitation measures in riot-affected areas with the senior officials at the office of northeast district magistrate on Saturday, Kejriwal said that all the 69 applicants would be given the money by Sunday so that they can restart their life.

The authorities distributed the application forms on Saturday in the affected areas. “Priority of the government is to restore normalcy,” the CM said.

Kejriwal appealed to the people, who have left their homes, to come back and resume a normal life. He said that the task to identify the victims has almost been completed. “All SDMs have carried out inspections in their respective areas and completed the identification of damage and affected people, but the government will be able to share the data only on Sunday.”

Kejriwal added that there is no crisis of food, and there is enough arrangement for shelter. “The security of the public will be ensured. Orders have already been issued to repair all the defunct street lights.”

Most of the relief camps set up by the government in Shashtri Park, Seelampur, GTB Hospital, Kabool Nagar and other places have zero to few people as the riot-affected people prefer the comfort and security of their relatives’ houses than the relief camps.

“A few people had come to the camp on Thursday and Friday, but they all spent just a night there. They were mostly the attendants of the people who were injured and hospitalised,” said Dharmendra Kumar, a vendor near the relief camp at GTB Hospital Gate No. 3.

The relief camps though appeared clean, and rugs, blankets, mattresses and pillows were neatly stacked for the needy people.

In the Kabool Nagar camp, which is located around three kilometres from Jaffrabad where the communal violence raged for a couple of days, not many turn up to take shelter. “It was not risk free to walk three kilometres and take shelter in the relief camps. People preferred the houses of their relatives for security reasons,” said Md Irshaq, a local.

Delhi government had opened 11 relief camps to provide accommodation to the people who were displaced in the violence.

Meanwhile, health minister Satyendar Jain visited GTB Hospital on Saturday to meet the riot victims and their families. “We are monitoring medical condition of all the victims and are committed to take every possible step to ensure their speedy recovery,” he stated on Twitter.

Title: Additional coaches to meet Holi rush
Content:
Ahmedabad: To meet the rush of passengers during Holi vacation, the Indian railways has decided to have additional coaches in 17 pairs of trains from Ahmedabad.

An additional AC three-tier coach will be added permanently in Porbandar-Howrah Express, Porbandar-Sikandrabad, Ahmedabad-Kolkata, Jamnagar-Tirunelveli and Hapa-Madgaon trains.

A sleeper coach and a third AC coach will be added permanently in Ahmedabad-Patna, Ahmedabad-Lucknow, Ahmedabad-Varanasi, Ahmedabad-Prayagraj, Bandra-Bhuj, Ahmedabad-Gorakhpur, Ahmedabad-Sultanpur, Rajkot-Reva, Hapa-Bilaspur and Gandhidham-Puri trains.

An additional sleeper coach will be attached in Rajkot-Delhi Sarai Rohilla, Bhavnagar-Surendranagar-Delhi Sarai Rohilla trains. Some trains will have additional coaches on temporary basis from March 8 to March 30. These trains include Porbandar–Santragachi, Porbandar-Delhi Sarai Rohilla, Porbandar-Kochuveli, Porbandar-Motihari, Bhavnagar-Kochuveli, Okha-Dehradun, Gandhinagar-Indore, and Bandra-Ahmedabad-Jammu Tavi among others. tnn

Title: Waqf land encroached by land mafia: Board
Content:
Charminar: Telangana State Waqf Board (TSWB) here on Saturday conducted a meeting with Rangareddy and Vikarabad district collectors as well as revenue, police and municipal officials to discuss protection of Waqf properties and removal of illegal encroachments.

TSWB chairman Mohammed Saleem said that land mafia have occupied Waqf land measuring hundreds of acres through illegal pattas. “The board has requested the revenue department and other officials concerned to cancel all illegal pattas,” he said.

He further said that criminal cases will be booked against the land mafia and all necessary steps will be taken to remove illegal occupants from Waqf properties.

The board has already take up the case of Waqf land owned by Dargah Hazrat Saif Nawaz Jung at Mamidipally, Balapur, Ashoorkhana Ali Saad Mamidipally, Balapur, Dargah Baba Sharfuddin Pahadisharif and its attached land at Survey No. 99/1, Masjid Alimgir and Eidgah Guttala Begumpet, Dargah Hazrat Maqdoom Biyabani, Ashoor khana Pudur, Vikarabad, Ashoorkhana Imam e Qasim at Dharoor.

Title: Cong to cornerTRS govt on farmers’ sops
Content:
Hyderabad: Congress will corner TRS in the budget session on its failure to fulfill poll promises like waiving off crop loans of up to Rs 1 lakh, not giving Rythu Bandhu sop to over 10 lakh farmers, not solving turmeric farmers’ problems, and non-implementation of unemployment allowance, among others.

At a meeting of party MLAs, MLCs and senior leaders held on Saturday, TPCC chief N Uttam Kumar Reddy and CLP leader Bhatti Vikramarka decided to fight for the cause of farmers in Parliament and assembly.

Congress also demanded that the government table the new Revenue Act in the budget session. “They have neither consulted the opposition nor provided a draft copy of the Act. We get to hear about it through media,” All India Kisan Congress vice-president M Kodanda Reddy said.

Title: In a 1st, Rajasthan govt places curbs on Ajmer pilgrims from Pak
Content:
AJMER/JAIPUR: Soon after the arrival of a delegation of 211 Pakistani pilgrims in Ajmer for Urs celebrations, the district administration on Saturday imposed curbs on them citing visa rules. Urs, which began on February 17, will continue till March 6 and Pakistani pilgrims will be here till March 7.

“It is clear in the visa rules that the delegation will move in a group during their visit. They will be taken to the dargah in a group during the hours decided in consultation with members of the delegation. It will help us in providing security to them,” said Ajmer SP Kunwar Rastradeep.

For the first time, Pakistani pilgrims have been asked to visit the shrine for a specific duration instead of going to the dargah any time of the day.

They are also not allowed to visit any Hujra (priest seat) or the house of their Khadim (priest), which they otherwise used to do. The restrictions have clearly made the pilgrims unhappy.The Pakistani pilgrims have been kept on the premises of a central girls’ government school at Naya Bazaar in Ajmer, which is about 1km from the shrine.The restrictions were conveyed to the leader of the Pakistani delegation during a meeting with dargah committee officials and members of the Khadim community at the SP office on Saturday.

The administration has provided the Pakistani pilgrims a duration of 6-10 hours on a daily basis, depending upon the auspiciousness of the day. Sources said that their visit time will be 2pm onwards.

Requesting anonymity, some Pakistani delegates said the time restriction would not allow them to offer five prayers a day on any day.

“The restriction in visit hours is in accordance with the visa rules. They will not be allowed to visit the shrine beyond the specific hours and they have to move in a group or in small groups inside the shrine under police cover,” the SP told TOI over the phone.

Other restrictions include eating food inside the dargah premises. The Pakistani pilgrims have been categorically told not to eat inside (the shrine) or at the residences of their Khadims, which will disunite the group violating visa rules.

The Pakistani delegates have also been advised to not speak to the media and to not engage in any conversation on any controversial topic with locals or other pilgrims.

“The administration has set up a canteen for them inside the school. If any Khadim or anyone wants to treat the pilgrims, they can bring the food to the canteen. It will help us monitor them properly. All arrangements have been made to make the pilgrimage of the Pakistani delegates hassle-free,” the SP said.

Title: Telangana: 2-year-old dies after being hit by school bus in Ghatkesar
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: A two-year-old boy died after a school bus ran over him in Ghatkesar on Saturday afternoon. The accident occurred when the toddler was playing outside his house. The bus belonged to the school that the victim’s brother was studying in.

Ghatkesar police said that four-year-old Manoj Kumar had gone to school in the same bus at around 8am on Saturday. At around 12.30 pm, the school bus had arrived at victim’s house to drop Manoj. At the time, Manoj’s younger brother, Mahesh, was playing outside the house. After Manoj stepped out of the vehicle, the bus driver, who failed to notice the boy standing in front of the bus, drove ahead and ended up hitting Mahesh.

The toddler died on the spot. The family members registered a complaint with Ghatkesar police seeking action against the driver of the school bus, Syed Ali. A case was registered under Section 304 A ( causing death by negligence) of Indian Penal Code.

The victim’s parents who hail from Warangal, migrated to Hyderabad four years ago. Mahesh’s father is a mason.

For the first time, Pakistani pilgrims have been asked to visit the shrine for a specific duration instead of going to the dargah any time of the day.

They are also not allowed to visit any Hujra (priest seat) or the house of their Khadim (priest), which they otherwise used to do. The restrictions have clearly made the pilgrims unhappy.The Pakistani pilgrims have been kept on the premises of a central girls’ government school at Naya Bazaar in Ajmer, which is about 1km from the shrine.The restrictions were conveyed to the leader of the Pakistani delegation during a meeting with dargah committee officials and members of the Khadim community at the SP office on Saturday.

The administration has provided the Pakistani pilgrims a duration of 6-10 hours on a daily basis, depending upon the auspiciousness of the day. Sources said that their visit time will be 2pm onwards.

Requesting anonymity, some Pakistani delegates said the time restriction would not allow them to offer five prayers a day on any day.

“The restriction in visit hours is in accordance with the visa rules. They will not be allowed to visit the shrine beyond the specific hours and they have to move in a group or in small groups inside the shrine under police cover,” the SP told TOI over the phone.

Other restrictions include eating food inside the dargah premises. The Pakistani pilgrims have been categorically told not to eat inside (the shrine) or at the residences of their Khadims, which will disunite the group violating visa rules.

The Pakistani delegates have also been advised to not speak to the media and to not engage in any conversation on any controversial topic with locals or other pilgrims.

“The administration has set up a canteen for them inside the school. If any Khadim or anyone wants to treat the pilgrims, they can bring the food to the canteen. It will help us monitor them properly. All arrangements have been made to make the pilgrimage of the Pakistani delegates hassle-free,” the SP said.

Title: Vyapam scam accused found heading government hospital in Madhya Pradesh
Content:
Dr Amit Kumar Yadav

AGRA: A doctor who was named by CBI as an accused in the Vyapam scam was found to be working as the superintendent of a government hospital in Madhya Pradesh’s Datia district despite many courts, including the Supreme Court, rejecting his bail pleas. The accused, who is the son of a BSP politician, used forged documents to get the job, claimed hospital authorities.

Dr Amit Kumar Yadav, who worked as the superintendent of government hospital, Datia, allegedly used fraudulent means to clear PMT 2006 exam and was named as the accused number one in the CBI chargesheet filed in December 2019.

According to the CBI, with the help of middlemen Deepak Yadav (Gwalior, MP) and Surender Verma (Fatehpur, Uttar Pradesh), Dr Yadav hired impersonator Prabhat Chaudhary (Sambhal, UP) to appear for him.

Following the chargesheet, Gwalior district court issued a non-bailable warrant against Dr Yadav, but he applied for bail in HC, which was rejected on February 27. The accused doctor is now absconding.

When contacted, Dr Rajesh Gaur, dean of government hospital, Datia, told TOI, “The doctor had filed a false affidavit and hid the fact that he was the prime accused in the Vyapam scam to obtain the job. We are going to take action against him on Monday.”

A senior government doctor, who didn’t wish to be named, said, “At least five times, Dr Yadav’s bail was rejected by various courts, including SC, but he was never arrested. In fact, he continued to work as hospital superintendent and was later made the nodal officer for an upcoming hospital project worth Rs 250 crore.”

Dr Yadav’s father Lakhan Singh Yadav is a well-known contractor who had contested the 2018 assembly polls from Sewda assembly constituency on a BSP ticket. He stood third.

“In April 2018, Dr Yadav was selected by the Datia hospital administration as assistant professor for forensic medicine, even though 10 candidates who appeared for the job interview were way more qualified than him. Dr Yadav did his MD in forensic medicine from a private college,” the doctors said.

Government hospital dean Dr Gaur said, “The accused doctor was removed from all the posts several weeks ago. Our committee is going through his case closely.”

As many as 289, including pre-medical test candidates, their parents, impersonators and middlemen, were named as accused in a supplementary chargesheet filed by the CBI in the Gwalior court in connection with alleged irregularities in the MP Vyapam case in December last year.

Out of the total, 41 impersonators and middlemen are from UP, mainly from Agra, Aligarh, Sambhal, Hamirpur, Allahabad, Mirzapur, Kaushambi, Kanpur, Mau, Deoria, Azamgarh and other districts.

Title: Pollution board extends consent to Mopa greenfield airport by 3 years
Content:
Panaji: The Goa State Pollution Control Board (GSPCB) has extended the validity of its consent to establish the greenfield airport at Mopa by three years.

GMR Goa International Airport Ltd had approached the board seeking that consent to establish under the Air and Water Acts be extended. Its application was placed before the board’s technical advisory committee on December 2 last year, during which extension of validity was recommended.

Once ready, the airport at Mopa will handle 4.4 million passengers per annum. Although it was slated to be completed by September this year, the state cabinet extended the deadline up to May 30, 2022 owing to delays in the project caused by litigations.

The government had signed a concession agreement with GMR Goa to develop the airport on a public-private partnership on November 8, 2016. Construction of phase I began on September 4, 2017. The state appointed Engineers India Ltd, a Government of India entity, to supervise progress.

The project, however, faced constraints where the felling of trees was concerned. A 365-day stay by the Supreme Court was also imposed against the environmental clearance granted by the Union ministry of environment, forest and climate change.

On January 16 this year, the apex court upheld the environment clearance and allowed construction to resume. It said that although there was a stay on the felling of trees for 167 days, there was no stay on the project. The pace of construction, however, slowed down considerably.

The overall progress achieved during the stay on tree felling was 5.3% as against planned progress of 10.9%.

Title: 105 UPSRTC buses to make additional trips on Holi
Content:
Agra: As many as 105 UPSRTC buses of Agra region will be making additional trips over the busy routes on the occasion of Holi. The special operation plan will be implemented from March 6 to 15. Drivers, conductors and workshop staffers will not be allowed to take leave during the festive period.

According to the UPSRTC officials, buses from the Inter-State Bus Terminal (ISBT) and Idgha bus station will be making extra trips on Delhi, Noida, Ghaziabad, Jaipur, Dholpur, Bharatpur, Mathura, Firozabad, Mainpuri, Aligarh, Hathras, Etah etc.

To ensure convenience of passengers going to celebrate Holi in Mathura, UPSRTC has planned to increase the trips of 50 buses operating on Agra and Mathura route. In Agra, passengers will be getting a bus to Mathura, Vrindavan, Goverdhan and Barsana every hour.

The state roadways administration has directed all the regional officers to ensure that buses facing any problem are repaired on priority basis. A special team will remain on standby to swiftly address mechanical problem in buses delaying operations.

SP Singh, UPSRTC service manager, said, “We have prepared a 10-day special operations plan from March 6 to 15. Additional trips of the bus will be made on bus routes. We will be sending buses to different stations on basis of the number of passengers. All the employees and officials concerned with the operations are required to remain on duty during the festive period. The state government has announced incentive for drivers, conductors and workshop staffers for extra efforts to ensure convenience of the passengers.”

Title: Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on edge, but sit-in continues
Content:
Protesters raise slogans during a demonstration against the CAA and NCR at Shaheen Bagh (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Behind the main tent at the Shaheen Bagh protest , groups stood around watching relief material being collected for the riot-hit areas in northeast Delhi. Inside the tent, the speeches and songs continued at a slower pace, but exhorting the same messages of peace. “No matter what the slight to us, we will not lose our peace,” said a volunteer, visibly upset.

Celebrating the “nari shakti” in demonstration the last 77 days, one speaker said, “The nation has looked up to you, and you have made history.”

A visit by police in the first half of the day followed by the cops walking through the colony and a drone hovering over the neighbourhood led to some anxious moments, said the protesters. A ‘march’ announced by a Hindu fringe outfit had been called off, the police had said, but “can one ever be sure?”, said a woman in her 50s, referring to the sense of betrayal many spoke of in the days following the attacks.

Some perceived the police’s visit as a “sign to be wary of” while others said “police had been coming around often,” and that Saturday’s visit to the protest site was “no different”.

If some talk of “Supreme Court has said it will hear the matter on March 23 and nothing can be done before that,” there are those who are “ready for anything untoward, what can one do?”

Anxiety has them further rooted to the ground, though as the rain came down, many raced home. A peace march planned for Sunday will now depend on the weather.

Title: Telangana: Chief secretary Somesh Kumar takes stock of budget preparations
Content:
Somesh Kumar

HYDERABAD: Chief secretary Somesh Kumar has directed the heads of various departments to submit details of new presidential order to the general administration department (GAD) by March 4.

The chief secretary held a review meeting with officials at BRKR Bhavan on implementation of the new presidential order, replies to pending legislative assembly questions (LAQs) and legislative council auestions (LCQs), zero hour mentions, audit paras and preparation of outcome budget and notes on demand ahead of the budget session beginning on March 6.

Somesh said reports on the new presidential order submitted by departments to GAD and the finance wing have been sent with some observations to the departments concerned. He directed the officials to submit the proposals in accordance with rules by March 4 to GAD.

He also asked the officials to take utmost care regarding the questions raised during the previous assembly session and also on the present session. He directed to submit replies immediately and also coordinate with the assembly officials.

Title: Aligarh admin gets anti-CAA protesters to vacate from Jeevangarh area
Content:
Agra: Aligarh administration on Saturday managed to get anti-CAA protesters to vacate the Quarsi Bypass Anoop Shahar Road in Jeevangarh area. The protesters had blocked the road since Monday, a day after violence broke out between them and police, leaving eight persons injured.

Though the tents and barricades were removed by police from the road and the women protesters also cleared the way, in the evening, they again started gathering in large numbers just one kilometre from the earlier protest site on the same road. Later, all the protesters were convinced by their local community leaders to vacate the area and they themselves cleared the road.

Talking with TOI, DM CB Singh said the protesters wanted to give a memorandum, with some local demands, including no harassment if they end the protest and financial help to the person injured in the violence on Sunday night. He said the administration will look into it.

He added that he was informed that the protest would end after he received their memorandum. “Holding a protest is everyone’s democratic right but it should not cause inconvenience to the general public with blockades of roads,” he added.

Aligarh SSP Muniraj G said police will not allow anyone to disturb the city’s law and order.

Title: HC summons top guns of AMC, ADA over pothole-riddled roads
Content:
Agra: Allahabad high court has summoned commissioner of Agra Municipal Corporation ( AMC ), vice-chairman of Agra Development Authority ( ADA ) and executive officer of Agra Smart City Limited (ASCL) following a petition over pothole-riddled roads in the city and road traffic mismanagement. The petition was filed by a social organization, Civil Society of Agra. In its petition, it has said poor maintenance of roads causes frequent accidents.

Agra city is divided into 100 municipal wards with a 1,720 km road network. Every year, more than Rs 2 crore is spent on repairing the roads.

The petition said Agra appears as if it has been ravaged by war because most of the roads have developed potholes and cracks after the monsoon. Besides, continuous digging by one or the other government department not only raises a lot of dust but also makes mobility difficult. The waterlogging and potholes due to rain and digging hinder traffic and some people have lost their lives, it added.

Anil Sharma, general secretary of the Civil Society of Agra, said, “We travelled across the city to record traffic conditions. The condition of the roads in the city, particularly at the roundabouts, is worse. It has resulted in accidents as there are huge potholes. In fact, some are so huge that the chamber of the car touches the broken road and damages the vehicles. Every day, two-wheelers lose balance due to potholes on the road and hit the on-coming drivers.”

Social worker and member of the Civil Society Rajeev Saxena said, “There is no procedure of surveying of newly-constructed roads. Although the AMC, ADA and other government departments spend large sums of money on the construction of roads in Agra, there are still permanent potholes. Newly-constructed roads show signs of damage within a month. Authorities fail to fix responsibility on for poor quality road construction.”

Senior municipal councillor Shiromani Singh said, “Our writ petition highlighting the pathetic condition of city roads and ill-managed of the traffic system, that cause much inconvenience to the citizens, has been accepted by the high court. Municipal commissioner, ADA vice-chairman and executive officer of ASCL have been summoned by the court on March 24. We will pursue the matter to its logical conclusion.”

Roads at Madia Katra, Boghipura, Kailashpuri, Shahganj locality, Paschimpuri, Sikandra road, Maruti estate and interior roads of Pratapura locality, Belanganj, Peepal Mandi, Langdey ki Chowki and Daresi, Heerabagh, Devri road and Nunihai, are among those in dire need of repairs. Roads in Trans-Yamuna and Shahdara localities around Yamuna bridge and Guru-ka-Taal also require repairs.

Title: Making restaurant management simple digitally
Content:
With the entry of a slew of food delivery apps, eating out hasn’t just increased manyfold over the past three years, but the change has also steered restaurateurs to quickly adopt new technology. Enabling restaurateurs to efficiently manage and streamline operations, Ahmedabad-based start-up, PetPooja, came up with an effective solution to help restaurants adapt to the food app wave.

Past journey

Founded by an MBA from Indian Institute of Management, Lucknow (IIM-Lucknow), Parthiv Patel, and an MBA Apruv Patel in 2011, PetPooja helps digitize restaurants by building technology to streamline their operations to scale and make them more productive. “Food industry is a business that will never slow down but calls for adapting to changing times and formats. When it came to digitisation of the restaurant management system, all that existed was a billing machine and the PoS software that existed were extremely complex with a complex pricing structure and provided no after-sales support,” said Patel.

Changing this, PetPooja provides a PoS platform that enables restaurants to manage all of their operations effectively right from dine-in orders, online orders to billing and more. As on date, the start-up operates with 15,000+ restaurants in India and UAE, including brands such as La Pinoz, Honest and Doolally, among others.

Next steps

PetPooja recently received funding from a B2B e-commerce unicorn, Udaan. Over the years, the company launched a basic billing solution software for restaurants and an online portal for managers and owners. “Going forward, we plan to launch our indigenously developed restaurant robot to augment wait staff at restaurants.”

Challenges

One of the key challenges for PetPooja was to make an operating system that was comprehensive enough for owners to holistically manage operations while being simple enough for an ordinary biller to operate without much training, said Patel. “Creating interfaces that improves ease of adoption of new technology for employees with limited skills is a challenge and therefore, the focus is on adapting to their needs,” said Patel.

Secret to success

Creating value for restaurants through innovative solutions was the key focus, said Patel. “All we’re trying to do is to innovate, execute effectively, gather feedback and try again and remain futuristic in the process,” he said.

as told to Niyati Parikh

Title: Delhi Rain: After weekend rain in Delhi, more likely next week
Content:
Sudden rain in Delhi on Saturday evening

NEW DELHI: Thundershowers lashed parts of NCR on Saturday evening after the Indian Meteorological Department predicted moderately cloudy skies, strong surface winds, along with very light rain and hail at isolated places. The rains, which lasted for over a couple of hours, resulted in waterlogging in a number of areas in Delhi. As many as 18 flights bound for Delhi’s IGI airport were diverted to Lucknow, Ahmedabad and Jaipur.

Till 8.30pm, the Safdarjung station recorded 18.5mm rainfall, while Palam recorded 14.8mm.

Track the pollution level in your city

“An active western disturbance (WD) caused this rain in NCR. Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, north Rajasthan, west UP and East UP were also affected. Another WD will impact Delhi on March 4 and will hit NCR on March 5 and 6. Similar rain and thundershowers can be expected then,” Kuldeep Srivastava, head of IMD’s regional forecasting centre at Delhi, told TOI.

Earlier on Saturday, people in Delhi woke up to a windy morning with the minimum temperature at 16.2 degrees Celsius, four notches above the season’s average. The maximum temperature was 27.3 degrees Celsius, two notches above normal.

On Sunday, partly cloudy sky is expected with the possibility of very light rain or drizzle.

The maximum temperature is expected to remain around 25 degrees Celsius, while the minimum on Sunday will be around 14 degrees Celsius, IMD said.

The rain and windy conditions also helped the city air quality as the AQI on Saturday was ‘moderate’ at 135. According to SAFAR, a body under the Union ministry, the air quality might touch ‘satisfactory’ on Sunday.

Title: Nations call for ratification of ILO convention on domestic workers at international meet
Content:
Dhaka: With lakhs of female domestic and migrant workers subjected to sexual abuse, exploitation and forced to work in unhealthy conditions in several countries, a number of nations including India have decided to ratify the International Labour Organisation’s (ILO) 189th Convention on domestic workers.

The Parliamentary Caucus on Migration and Development, Bangladesh National Parliament was organised in association with the Migrant Forum in Asia.

Members of Parliament (MP) and civil society from Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, India and the Philippines, who met in Dhaka recently, spoke on the hardships suffered by migrant domestic workers from these countries in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) nations which include Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, UAE (comprising Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Sharjah, Umm al-Qaiwain, Fujairah, and Ra’s al Khaimah) Qatar, Bahrain and Oman. The MPs suggested that these GCC countries should also ratify ILO C 189.

“Domestic workers are human beings. They have to be treated with respect and dignity and their rights should be assured,” Bangladesh MP Md Israfil Alam said during the convention held on February 25 and 26.

The ILO C 189 which came into force in September 5, 2013, requires that several stipulations be met for the employment, treatment, and wages of domestic workers, freedom, protection against all forms of abuse, respect for their privacy, and decent living conditions.

“Bangladesh will also work towards ratifying the international convention and some local laws are already in place to protect domestic workers,” said MP Alam, who is also a migrant rights advocate.

Nepal MP Ram Kumari Jhakri said while his nation would also work towards ratifying the convention, it was equally important that GCC countries ratify it. “Migrant domestic workers from the origin countries should feel safe and protected in the GCC countries and therefore the member countries should ratify it,” she said.

Sri Lankan MP Sujith S Perera said MPs would strive for the ratification of the convention by Sri Lanka. “All the sending (origin) countries should form a regional forum where to show unity and guarantee the protection of rights and living conditions of domestic workers in the destination countries,” he said. The conference said due importance should be given to safe and legal migration.

Title: Buoyed by govt promises, Poinguinim ward to vote
Content:
Poinguinim: During the 2019 Lok Sabha elections , 221 eligible voters - residents of Marlim-Tirval ward of Poinguinim - had refused to cast their vote , accusing the government of ignoring repeated requests for basic needs like electricity, roads and water supply to their ward located within the Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary. On Friday, south Goa collector Ajit Roy met the villagers and assured them that they would get a tarred road, underground power cabling, piped water supply and a bus service.

After much deliberations during a meeting, which was also attended by Canacona deputy collector Pritidas Gaonkar, mamlatdar Vimod Dalal and assistant engineer (interior roads) Elvis Fernandes, the residents of Martim-Tirval, led by Poinguinim sarpanch Jagdish Gaonkar, agreed to exercise their franchise in the upcoming ZP elections.

The villagers were also toldthat the road to their village would be completed before the monsoons. It may be recalled that all the eligible voters had boycotted the parliamentary elections last year, after being upset over promises made during the previous elections were not fulfilled.

Title: Gwalior man creates bomb scare in train after brother’s connecting train delays by 4 hours
Content:
Agra: Gwalior man who tweeted a hoax bomb threat to railway ministry on New Delhi-Dibrugarh Rajdhani express on Friday evening, was sent to jail on Saturday evening after GRP presented him to the magistrate in Aligarh. Accused was annoyed about the four-hour-long delay of Kerala express; the connecting train to the national capital, which his elder brother was supposed to board to reach Delhi.

The man sent a tweet to the railway ministry on Friday evening when the Rajdhani was about to reach Ghaziabad junction. Taking prompt action of the tweet, GRP Agra division brought the train to a halt at Dadri junction, 17km away from Ghaziabad. However, after a thorough check of the train for three hours, no bomb was recovered.

According to GRP, the tweet was sent by a 25-year-old Sanjeev Kumar Gurjar, resident of New Vijay Vihar colony of Murar area, Gwalior district, Madhya Pradesh.

The tweet sent from his Twitter handle @sanjeevriyana1 tagged the railway minister Piyush Goyal and Delhi police. It read, “I want to inform that there are 5 bombs in a train rajdhani (12424) going from new delhi to kanpur central. Please take some action on this quickly. (sic).”

Speaking to TOI, Sachin Kaushik, the twitter handler of Agra GRP division, said, “As the tweet was brought to our notice, we immediately alerted our ground force in Dadri and also informed railway control room to stop the train immediately at Dadri junction. After three hours of thorough checking, nothing suspicious was found. Meanwhile, we also attempted to contact the person who made the tweet, but he did not reply.”

“Around 7pm, Sanjeev posted another tweet, apologising for the hoax message. He claimed that he was angry after his brother’s train was delayed for four hours.”

The tweet read, “Ye tweet mere dwara maansik tanav ki sthiti me kiya gaya tha, aaj mere bhai ki train 4 hr late ho gyi thi, jisse mujhe boht gussa tha, me iske liye bharat sarkar se maafi chahta hu. (sic)”

Senior superintendent of police, Agra GRP division, Jogendra Kumar said, “Sanjeev’s elder brother Rahul Gurjar, an army jawan posted in Kibithu, Arunachal Pradesh at 56 APO (army post office) Assam unit, was supposed to board the New Delhi-Dibrugarh Rajadhani express, but his connecting train Kerala express was running late by four hours. Therefore, in order to delay the Rajdhani, Sanjeev tweeted the hoax tweet from Gwalior.”

“The accused was arrested by Aligarh GRP team lead by SHO Raees Ahmad on Saturday. He has been booked under IPC 505 B (Statements conducing to public mischief with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against the public tranquillity) and 174 railway act (Obstructing running of train, etc).”

On Saturday, the accused was sent to jail.

Title: Hindus offer to sell houses in Muslim-dominated areas
Content:
Agra: Days after violence broke out in Aligarh’s Muslim-dominated Babri Mandi area, posters proclaiming, “yeh ghar bikau hai (this house is for sale)” have come up outside the dwellings of Hindus.

Hindu families residing in this sensitive area said they want to sell their property and move to “safer localities” as they feel “threatened” whenever incidents of violence occur in the area.

Talking with mediapersons, Neha Agarwal, a resident, said, “Babri Mandi area is not safe for Hindus. Whenever some communal violence occurs in any part of the city, this area is primarily affected as it is Muslim dominated.” She said now, it was impossible to live in the locality.

Another resident, Dwarka Prasad, said every day, “they” create hooliganism in the area due to ongoing anti-CAA protests across the city. “We want safety for our families and have decided to sell our property and move out,” he added.

An elderly woman, Sharda Devi, said she was injured on Sunday night after a group running away from police, bumped into her and she fell on the ground. “Communal tensions are nothing new in this city and I have been seeing it for long. But now, they have turned violent, which is not good for people who reside in the city peacefully,” she added.

Title: Elders feel a void as Mapusa’s 137-year library shut
Content:
The Athaide Municipal Library has remained shut since September

PANAJI: Residents of Mapusa , especially senior citizens , have been robbed of their opportunity to keep their minds active and healthy after the town’s lone public library was shut down.

The Athaide Municipal Library, one of the oldest in the state and in existence since 1883, used to receive large footfalls and was shut on September 13 last year with no immediate alternative arrangements made for its relocation.

The elderly, for whom the library and its reading hall provided an opportunity to keep abreast on current affairs and delay the onset of dementia and Alzheimer’s, are feeling the void after the old municipal building that housed the library was closed by the local civic body.

One of the regulars at the library was Mapusa resident and senior citizen Simon Pereira who would spend up to two hours reading various newspapers and magazines.

“Now I only read two newspapers at home as I cannot afford to buy six newspapers every day. I used to read The Times of India regularly at the library,” 78-year-old Pereira told TOI.

The reading hall was always crowded in the evenings, sometimes even making it difficult to find a seat, he said. “It was a good pastime for us. I’m missing it very much. What else is there for us to do in our old age?” he said.

Retired banker Allan Faria who frequented the library too agreed, saying the library was a home away from home for senior citizens.

Besides the large reading hall, the library with more than 6,000 members and 25,000 books in various languages also had a separate reference section and children’s section. Children are now forced to do any reference work at their own school library.

“It is the mission of the Central government to promote education and literacy and encourage the library movement. But in Mapusa, something that was running since 1883 has been closed with no alternate arrangements made. It is a shame that it is the only town in Goa without a library today,” Faria said.

Distressed citizens deprived by the closure of the library shot off letters in December last year to the Mapusa Municipal Council, Mapusa MLA, art and culture minister, directorate of art and culture, directorate of municipal administration, health services and civil supplies and consumer affairs requesting for an urgent decision to make alternate arrangements for shifting of the reading room and library to the old Asilo Hospital which has been renovated and not in use.

Mapusa MLA Joshua D’Souza, when contacted, told TOI that he has already moved a proposal to the health minister for the library and reading room to be temporarily shifted to the ground floor of the old Asilo Hospital building.

“The library had to be shut down because the roof was collapsing and after it was declared unsafe following structural surveys. We couldn’t take a risk. We are waiting for approval from the health minister to use the old Asilo building,” he said.

Title: Trains diverted to Secunderabad as travellers wait at Kacheguda
Content: SECUNDERABAD: Passengers waiting at Kacheguda railway station on Saturday were in for a rude shock after they found that their trains had been diverted to Secunderabad. South Central Railway (SCR) has diverted more than seven trains running from Kacheguda to different locations across Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka via Secunderabad till March 7. However, passengers said that they were not informed about the diversions.“We had reservations on Karnataka Sampark Kranti Express. It was supposed to arrive at Kacheguda at 8.20am, but after waiting for almost an hour-and-half we approached the railway attendants. Then, they told us that it was diverted through Secunderabad and Kazipet,” said Vishwanath Prasad, who missed his train to Bhopal.Sashi M, who was scheduled to travel to Anantapur, came to know that Kacheguda-Yesvantpur Express (train no. 16570) had been cancelled only after reaching the station.Many trains to Karnataka, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and New Delhi were also diverted or partially cancelled due to traffic block in the zones. “Twenty-three trains from the twin states to and from major stations have been cancelled till March 8. Four trains have been partially cancelled till March 7 between Kacheguda and Nandyal as well as Nandyal and Dhone,” said a SCR official.“Passengers are being intimated through SMS and e-mails if their trains have been affected. Our officials at the station and on social media are also on the watch to ensure that there is no confusion,” said an official from SCR.

Title: Firm gold prices increase recycling of gold; physical demand plunges
Content: Ahmedabad: Amid rising geopolitical tensions, gold prices have rallied in the international market, touching a high of $1,689 per ounce earlier this week. Since gold prices in the Gujarat market remained above the Rs 40,000-mark through most part of the festive and wedding season, the demand for physical gold has plunged, so much so that jewellery purchases are increasingly being made by exchanging previously purchased gold. In Ahmedabad, at least 70% of jewellery purchases are made by exchanging old gold, according to estimates by Jewellers’ Association of Ahmedabad (JAA).“Till a year ago, barely 30% gold jewellery was purchased by exchanging old gold whereas 70% were fresh purchases. However, with the rise in yellow metal prices and the recessionary trend, the ratio has reversed,” said Jigar Soni, vice-president, JAA.Similar is the situation in the diamond city of Surat, where consumers are shying away from making new purchases of gold jewellery due to the high prices of the yellow metal. In the last one month, the recycling of old gold has increased by about 35% in Surat and South Gujarat region. “Cash sales in the jewellery showrooms have gone down by almost 40% due to the high gold prices. Customers are preferring to recycle their old ornaments and coins for the jewellery. Out of 40kg of gold jewellery manufacturing per day in Surat, about 12kg consists of recycled gold,” said Nainesh Pachchigar, director, Indian Bullion Jewellers Association (IBJA).Gold prices have been on the upward trend since early last year. Thanks to this, the demand for gold has significantly reduced. According to data by Ahmedabad Air Cargo Complex, gold imports plunged to the lowest ever at 49.1 tonnes in the state in 2019, against 56.3MT in 2018.With reduced demand for physical gold, jewellers are facing significant loss in business. “Our business has come down to 25% as customers are reluctant to buy gold at such a high price. Those who need jewellery for marriages prefer to buy new designs in exchange of old jewellery,” said Bhayabhai Soni, president, Rajkot Gold Dealers’ Association (RGDA).Revenues of jewellers have also come down. Manoj Soni, an Ahmedabad-based jeweller said, “People come with a fixed budget for gold purchases and the proportion of transactions made through exchange of gold is high. As a result, revenues of jewellers have taken a hit. At the same time, purchase for gold jewellery other than wedding occasions has declined by more than 50%.”Rallying price trendWith the coronavirus infections spreading not just in China but other countries as well, gold prices have rallied in the international market. Yellow metal prices consequently touched a record high earlier this week, breaching the Rs 45,000-mark per 10g in Ahmedabad to settle at Rs 45,050 per 10g. “Gold prices are hovering around Rs 44,000 per 10g in the Ahmedabad market for about a week now. Due to this, the demand for physical gold has significantly declined and is impacting employment in the sector,” said Haresh Acharya, national director, IBJA.“With continuing geopolitical uncertainty, gold prices are expected to remain on the upward till the end of 2020. The spike in coronavirus cases is expected to have an adverse impact on global trade. and as a result, investors are moving towards safe-haven investments in gold,” said Sudhish Nambiath, head, India Gold Policy Centre (IGPC) – Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad (IIM-A).Employment hitThe volume of gold buying has reduced significantly. As a result, employment in the gems and jewellery sector is significantly impacted. Gujarat, which was home to some 1 lakh gold jewellery artisans a year ago, witnessed 40% of them moving to their home towns and refusing to return, say jewellers.“A number of jewellery artisans are changing their profession and moving to alternative means of employment. High price of gold is a deterrent for jewellery purchases, even during wedding as well as festive season. Some 500 jewellery manufacturing units – predominantly involved in job work – in Manek Chowk are now operating at 50% of its actual capacity as there is no work,” said Chinubhai Choksi, president, Manek Chowk Choksi Mahajan.Several gold artisans have now turned to agriculture, turned into fruit and vegetable vendors or began working as labourers at factories and printing presses in absence of jobs.“Because there is no work, we are not able to pay full salary to our artisans. Instead of four people, our unit is now operated by two people only,” said Salim Abbas, a jewellery making unit owner in Manek Chowk.“High gold prices have led to 35% rise in recycling of gold and a decline in cash sales at jewellery showrooms. That apart, workers from the manufacturing centres including Surat, Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Rajkot, Bengaluru and Coimbatore are leaving as they do not have enough work due to weak sales.” Anantha Padmanabhan, chairman, All Indian Gems and Jewellery Domestic Council

Title: 23 illegal drinking water packaging units sealed
Content:
Trichy: The public works department (PWD) sealed 51 illegal drinking water packaging units operating without license in Trichy and central districts on Sunday. The synchronised enforcement drive was carried out by the PWD groundwater division after the Madras high court on Thursday directed all district administrations to seal illegal water packaging units in their respective jurisdictions.

The units were extracting groundwater for commercial gains without obtaining the consent of the PWD groundwater division. Over 30 packaged drinking water units function in Trichy, of which 23 illegal units in Lalgudi, Thiruppuraithurai, Thiruverumbur and Trichy city were closed.

Of the total 14 blocks in the district, the central groundwater board has classified four blocks as over-exploited and one block under critical groundwater table category. Though packaged drinking water units are not permitted to operate in the above mentioned categories, PWD officials said that several packaged drinking water units were found operating from such blocks.

“The packaged drinking water units can function only from blocks with safe groundwater table that too after obtaining PWD consent. Borewells in the illegal packaged drinking water units were sealed and the managements were served with notices,” a PWD groundwater division official told TOI.

Seven PWD teams conducted raids and sealed borewells of 51 illegal packaged drinking water units in Trichy, Pudukkottai, Perambalur and Karur districts on Saturday.

The drive is likely to continue for the next two days. Officials said that the report on closure of the illegal drinking water packaging units shall be submitted to the high court. Some of the packaged drinking water units that were closed were operating with lapsed licenses.

Title: Tourist killed in accident
Content:
Saligao: Feroz Ali, 26, a tourist from Uttar Pradesh, died on the spot while two others sustained serious injuries in an accident at Baga , Arpora, on Friday.

Anjuna police said the accident occurred at around 5pm near a popular restaurant along the Baga creek road, when the scooter on which the trio was travelling skidded and rammed into a passenger rickshaw.

The injured, Mohit Kumar, 25, and Raju Khan, 22, were shifted to Goa Medical College and hospital, Bambolim.

Title: IT, pharma SEZs beat slowdown blues
Content:
Hyderabad: Notwithstanding the economic slowdown and ripple effect, IT and ITES companies and pharma firms in Telangana and neighbouring Andhra Pradesh have done exceptionally well in terms of exports in this financial year.
